title: Senior Business Analyst - Data
description:
EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.

We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst to drive business analysis and data integration projects within our dynamic team.

You will collaborate closely with clients, product owners, and development teams to translate requirements and ensure successful delivery. Join us to make a significant impact and advance your career in a supportive environment.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Conduct thorough business requirements elicitation, gathering and documentation
• Translate business requirements into functional, non-functional requirements and technical stories
• Break down epics into INVEST user stories and document acceptance criteria
• Decompose features into end-to-end scenarios and create user journeys and diagrams
• Utilize Agile and SAFe methodologies to maintain the software development lifecycle
• Write clear technical stories that communicate complex concepts effectively
• Demonstrate working knowledge of API features and data integration techniques
• Communicate effectively with business stakeholders and developers
• Initiate and lead internal discussions to ensure offshore development team alignment
• Be available to address developer questions and remove blockers within the working day
• Balance customer focus with internal team needs to ensure clarity and address concerns
• Collaborate closely with Product Owners, stakeholders, and cross-functional teams
• Use AI-assisted tools to enhance day-to-day work efficiency
• Facilitate meetings, support client decision-making, and manage conflicts when necessary

REQUIREMENTS
• Extensive experience in business analysis with 7-9 years of relevant work
• Proven leadership in coordinating distributed teams and managing stakeholder relationships
• Strong expertise in business requirements definition and documentation
• Advanced skills in data modeling and data integration
• Solid understanding of Agile and SAFe methodologies
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
• Demonstrated ability to write clear technical stories and user scenarios
• Proactive problem-solving skills and ability to take ownership of complex tasks
• Ability to work effectively in distributed environments with onshore and offshore teams
• Flexibility in adapting to evolving client needs and priorities
• Strong facilitation skills for meetings and conflict management
• Ability to balance multiple stakeholder demands and maintain team alignment
• English language proficiency at B2 level or higher

WE OFFER
• Opportunity to work on technical challenges that may impact across geographies
• Vast opportunities for self-development: online university, knowledge sharing opportunities globally, learning opportunities through external certifications
• Opportunity to share your ideas on international platforms
• Sponsored Tech Talks & Hackathons
• Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
• Possibility to relocate to any EPAM office for short and long-term projects
• Focused individual development
• Benefit package
• Health benefits
• Retirement benefits
• Paid time off
• Flexible benefits
• Forums to explore beyond work passion (CSR, photography, painting, sports, etc.)

title: TECHNICAL BUSINESS ANALYST / BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST
description:
Technical Business Analyst

Elite Technical is seeking a Business Analyst. This position is remote except for occasional client meetings, and the first week of employment (First week will require onsite, M-F). Responsibilities Include:- Lead data mapping and integration efforts between Aladdin and IVZ performance systems.
• Translate business needs into technical requirements focused on performance and reporting.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to define source-to-target mapping and data requirements.
• Support the ingestion and transformation of Aladdin data into Snowflake and Aladdin Data Cloud.
• Conduct SQL and Python-based queries to validate data accuracy and support analytics.

5+ years of experience in Asset Management as a Business Systems Analyst (BSA)
• Strong functional knowledge of performance reporting and investment data
• Hands-on experience with Aladdin Accounting, PBOR, and Aladdin Platform.
• Proficiency in Snowflake, Aladdin Data Cloud, and data integration workflows.
• Advanced skills in SQL and Python for data querying and analysis.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Job role:

We are looking for a tech-savvy Business Analyst, Pre-Sales Representative with an ability to do hands-on Sales. Your role will be to seek new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers. You will be speaking to Who's Who of the fintech world.

It is an added advantage if you have experience in developing leads from marketing campaigns and meeting sales quotas. You will be responsible for the entire sales cycle from establishing customer contact until signing a deal. You will also ensure proper after-sales service.

Job Location: Indore | Full Time | Experience: 0 to 6 years | Salary ∝ Expertise | Rs.1.8L ~ Rs.3L | Freshers allowed

About the company:

Anaxee Digital Runners is building India's largest last-mile verification & data collection network of Digital Runners (shared feet-on-street, tech-enabled) to help Businesses & Consumers reach remotest parts of India, on-demand. KYC | Field Verification | Data Collection | eSign | Tier-2, 3 & 4

We want to make REACH across India (remotest places), as easy as ordering pizza, on-demand. Already serving 11000 pin codes (57% of India) | Website: www.anaxee.com

Important: Check out our company pitch (6 min video) to understand this goal - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7QnyJsKedz8

Responsibilities:
• This is not another Sales job, it involves Concept Selling too.
• Find customers for Products & Services provided by the company
• Contact potential clients via phone, emails, and LinkedIn
• Identify client needs and suggest appropriate products/services
• Customize product solutions to increase customer satisfaction
• Build long-term trusting relationships with clients
• Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market
• Directly report to the CEO
• Stay up-to-date with new products/services and new pricing/payment plans
• Keep an eye on the competition.

Requirements:
• Proven work experience as a Business Development Representative, Sales Account Executive or similar role
• Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (eg: inbound, outbound, field sales)
• Track record of achieving sales quotas
• Experience with CRM software, Online tools for effective sales
• Understanding of sales performance metrics
• Excellent communication and negotiation skills, Good Email writing skills
• Ability to deliver engaging presentations
• Degree in Marketing, Business Administration or relevant field.

title: Business Analyst - 45430
description:
About the Role:

We’re hiring a Business Analyst to manage and mentor a team of analysts creating business-focused content to improve AI models. You’ll combine leadership, quality oversight, and subject expertise in MBA-relevant domains to ensure outputs are accurate, logically sound, and aligned with project goals. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys people management, operational excellence, and shaping high-quality analytical content. No prior AI experience is required for this role.

What You’ll Do:
• Lead and mentor a team of Business Analysts/Content Specialists.
• Allocate tasks, oversee workflows, and ensure timely, high-quality delivery.
• Conduct QA reviews, refine processes, and improve team efficiency.
• Provide performance feedback, training, and career development.
• Act as the primary stakeholder contact, sharing regular project updates.
• Guide creation of case studies, scenarios, and structured business content (finance, policy, e-commerce, etc.).

What We’re Looking For:
• 2+ years of team management experience.
• 3–6 years in business analysis, consulting, content, or domain-focused projects.
• Strong analytical, logical, and communication skills.
• Proficiency in structured file formats (TSV, JSON, HTML, XML, Markdown).
• No prior AI experience is required
• Bonus: prior work on LLM performance data, case study writing, or academic/research content.
• Full-time commitment (40 hrs/week);
immediate joiners preferred.

Why Join Us:
• Competitive pay and flexible remote work.
• Lead a team working on cutting-edge AI projects.
• Exposure to advanced LLMs and how they’re trained.
• Freelance perks: autonomy, flexibility, and global collaboration.
• Potential for contract extension.

Offer Details:
• Commitments Required: 40 hours per week with 4 hours of overlap with PST.
• Engagement type: Contractor assignment/freelancer (no medical/paid leave)
• Duration: 1 month.

Application Process:
• Shortlisted candidates will be sent an automated challenge (60 mins).
• Once you clear the challenge, we will reach out to you for an interview.
• Once you clear the interview, you are ready to go!

About Turing:

Turing, based in San Francisco, is the world’s leading research accelerator for frontier AI labs and a trusted partner for global enterprises. We advance cutting-edge research with high-quality data, training pipelines, and top AI talent across coding, reasoning, STEM, multilinguality, multimodality, and agents. We also help enterprises turn AI from proof-of-concept into proprietary systems that deliver reliable performance, measurable impact, and real results on the P&L.

Know amazing talent? Refer them at turing.Com/referrals, and earn money from your network.

title: Senior Analyst, Software Engineering | Senior Business Analyst
description:
Key Responsibilities:
• Lead requirements gathering and elicitation by engaging with stakeholders to understand and document business needs.
• Analyze data trends and metrics to generate actionable insights for business strategies.
• Create and analyze process maps (using BPMN, Visio, etc.) to identify inefficiencies and recommend workflow optimizations.
• Lead cross-functional project teams ensuring alignment between business objectives and technical implementations.
• Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation including business requirements documents, use cases, process flows, and user manuals.
• Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to facilitate clear communication and understanding.
• Oversee testing and validation efforts including user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure deliverables meet requirements.

title: Technical Business Analyst-content & personalization
description:
The Opportunity:

This is a hands-on role which offers rich opportunities to grow in the technology industry working on leading Adobe tech areas such Content commerce and Personalization, The candidate should bring in good working experience of working on Adobe technology and should have demonstrated this via quantifiable and qualitative experience. The TBA conducting analyses and developing high impact recommendations and oversee the overall program as the client custodian aligned to client priorities and leadership. He/she will also have opportunities to lead business initiatives and help innovate and strategize the Martech platform initiatives.

The primary responsibility includes insight generation, providing recommendations & decisions for implementation, driving critical metric measurement, and executive reporting of KPIs across Adobe products , AEM , Adobe commerce and Personalization The person will partner closely with Technology and Marketing teams to innovate and drive well-rounded website strategy and personalization use case implementation across multiple brand websites.

Responsibilities:
• Develop customer insights and analysis by identifying and providing data insights for Content / websites development.
• Collaborate and communicate with multiple stakeholders holding an Agile first Marketing transformation.
• Drive discussions and program plan with website build partners and internal stakeholders
• Design and automate reporting that drives an improved understanding of product usage & User journey in Adobe Experience cloud.
• Develop and run ad-hoc reports to answer business questions and support data-driven decision-making when needed.
• Use multiple data sources to provide a view of the customer journey across products.
• Find innovative ways to search for relevant patterns, trends, and relationships amongst large data volumes that lead to business/ product improvement.

Skills:
• 6 to 8 years of proven experience in technology, product/marketing analytics and driving concrete insights.
• Worked on at least one large transformation program end to end in AEM ( latest versions ) , Adobe commerce and Adobe Target
• Exposure to multiple content management and personalization products will be an added advantage.
• Strong analytical and quantitative orientation and a good team player
• Proven understanding of how content systems work in a multi website and other customer touch points, in a complex client environment.
• Ability to support programs with high content velocity and digital assets.
• Strong presentation and interpersonal skills
• Can clearly, concisely, optimally across multiple levels within the organization, ability to transform data into clear presentations for leadership.

title: Business Analyst/PMO
description:
About BNP Paribas India Solutions:

Established in 2005, BNP Paribas India Solutions is a wholly owned subsidiary of BNP Paribas SA, European Union’s leading bank with an international reach. With delivery centers located in Bengaluru, Chennai and Mumbai, we are a 24x7 global delivery center. India Solutions services three business lines: Corporate and Institutional Banking, Investment Solutions and Retail Banking for BNP Paribas across the Group. Driving innovation and growth, we are harnessing the potential of over 10000 employees, to provide support and develop best-in-class solutions.

About BNP Paribas Group:

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank and key player in international banking. It operates in 65 countries and has nearly 185,000 employees, including more than 145,000 in Europe. The Group has key positions in its three main fields of activity: Commercial, Personal Banking & Services for the Group’s commercial & personal banking and several specialised businesses including BNP Paribas Personal Finance and Arval; Investment & Protection Services for savings, investment, and protection solutions; and Corporate & Institutional Banking, focused on corporate and institutional clients. Based on its strong diversified and integrated model, the Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporates and institutional clients) to realize their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings and protection insurance. In Europe, BNP Paribas has four domestic markets: Belgium, France, Italy, and Luxembourg. The Group is rolling out its integrated commercial & personal banking model across several Mediterranean countries, Turkey, and Eastern Europe. As a key player in international banking, the Group has leading platforms and business lines in Europe, a strong presence in the Americas as well as a solid and fast-growing business in Asia-Pacific. BNP Paribas has implemented a Corporate Social Responsibility approach in all its activities, enabling it to contribute to the construction of a sustainable future, while ensuring the Group's performance and stability

Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At BNP Paribas, we passionately embrace diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all employees are valued, respected and can bring their authentic selves to work. We prohibit Discrimination and Harassment of any kind and our policies promote equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants, irrespective of, but not limited to their gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, colour, national origin, age, religion, social status, mental or physical disabilities, veteran status etc. As a global Bank, we truly believe that inclusion and diversity of our teams is key to our success in serving our clients and the communities we operate in.

About Business line/Function:

Global banking IT in ISPL caters to multiple Core banking and Corporate Banking software application needs. Corporate Banking encompasses all of the financing products and services for corporate customers from transaction banking (cash management, international trade finance and liquidity management) to financing solutions.

Position Purpose

As a business analyst articulate business / operational needs and define the appropriate technology solution. Projects in scope involve optimization of the workflows, increase in efficiency and productivity for Global Banking Business and Operational platforms.

As a PMO analyst oversees the entire portfolio of collective projects and programs across the Deportment. PMO Analysts provide analytical support to the PMO team and Management. Collect and analyze project reports and data, such as budgets, schedules, and performance metrics for identifying trends, issues, and opportunities for improvement.

Responsibilities

Direct Responsibilities

· Convert Business requirements into Functional specifications

· Prepare Functional Specifications and System Requirements

· Ensure that design is align with Group policies and industry practices, as well as, Regulatory requirements.

· Challenge both Business and IT requirements in order to ensure they are consistent, relevant, and robust.

· Explain the functional specification to the development team and provide support to clarify and guide development teams on functional requirements

· Write test cases and test the IT deliveries before users, in order to verify conformity to the specifications as well as, non-regression.

· Conduct qualification of releases and IST. Provide functional support during UAT

· Prepare User guides, Business Cases, Training Material, Production Support procedures

· Record and compile data in an Excel, using spreadsheet features and tools including pivot tables, lookups, complex formulas and graphing to produce key data points for use by the team. Develop macros to speed up complex tasks

· Design and build effective models to consolidate different types of data with the ability to slice and dice as needed.

· Perform internal audit to ensure all deployments including releases are upto BNPP standards and practices.

· Provide Weekly report/Monthly report of budget utilization to leadership

· Manage SLAs, Contracts, SOWs, Work orders and invoice payments to vendors and service providers. Acquire necessary approvals from Risk, Legal and Procurement and Management .

title: Business Analyst 5
company: PRI INDIA IT SERVICES PRIVATE LIMITED
description: Summary: The main function of a business operations specialist is to maintain vendor relationships, acting as a business analyst for non-IT projects or filling organizational roles above an administrative level, but below a management level. Other responsibilities may include maintaining all project management processes, including project goals, deadlines, metrics and budget. The business operations specialist usually reports to a project manager or director. Job Responsibilities: Review and approve contracts, cost proposals and contract supplements. Approve project and work breakdown structures. Review and approve the documentation of business processes. Approve project budgets and expenditures, monitor transaction controls and costs against budgets. Predict potential budget overruns and offer solutions. Consult with corporate offices, project managers, auditors, client and sub-consultant representatives regarding future proposals. Prepare sub-agreements and review and input sub-consultant invoices to ensure contact compliance. Previous experience with computer applications, such as Microsoft Word and Excel; Enterprise Application experience a plus. title: Business Analytics Analyst
description:
The Business Analytics Analyst is a developing professional role. Applies specialty area knowledge in monitoring, assessing, analyzing and/or evaluating processes and data. Identifies policy gaps and formulates policies. Interprets data and makes recommendations. Researches and interprets factual information. Identifies inconsistencies in data or results, defines business issues and formulates recommendations on policies, procedures or practices. Integrates established disciplinary knowledge within own specialty area with basic understanding of related industry practices. Good understanding of how the team interacts with others in accomplishing the objectives of the area. Develops working knowledge of industry practices and standards. Limited but direct impact on the business through the quality of the tasks/services provided. Impact of the job holder is restricted to own team.

Responsibilities:
• Gathers operational data from various cross functional stakeholders to examine past business performance
• Identifies data patterns & trends, and provides insights to enhance business decision making capability in business planning, process improvement, solution assessment etc.
• Recommends actions for future developments & strategic business opportunities, as well as enhancements to operational policies
• May be involved in exploratory data analysis, confirmatory data analysis and/or qualitative analysis
• Translate data into consumer or customer behavioral insights to drive targeting and segmentation strategies, and communicate clearly and effectively to business partners and senior leaders all findings
• Continuously improve processes and strategies by exploring and evaluating new data sources, tools, and capabilities
• Work closely with internal and external business partners in building, implementing, tracking and improving decision strategies
• Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications:
• 2 to 4 years relevant experience
• Good communication skills (both verbal and written) and ability to work with cross-functional partners and team members

Education:
• Bachelors/University degree or equivalent experience

This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

title: Business Analyst with API
description:
As a Business Analyst at our company, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between business requirements and technical solutions, particularly focusing on API integrations. Your responsibilities will include:

- Collaborating with stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document business requirements.
- Translating business needs into detailed functional and technical specifications, specifically for API integrations.
- Working closely with developers, QA, and product teams to ensure solutions are aligned with business goals.
- Analyzing and mapping data between systems to support API-based integrations and workflows.
- Creating and maintaining user stories, use cases, and process flows.
- Conducting impact analysis, gap analysis, and feasibility assessments for new or changing API requirements.
- Supporting end-to-end testing efforts, including defining test cases, verifying data accuracy, and coordinating UAT.
- Assisting in API documentation review and enhancement for internal and external consumption.
- Identifying opportunities to improve business processes and proposing system enhancements.

To be successful in this role, you should possess the following qualifications:

- Experience as a Business Analyst in a technology or product-driven environment.
- Proven experience working with RESTful APIs, JSON/XML data formats, and API documentation tools like Swagger and Postman.
- Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
- Ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
- Basic understanding of system architecture, integrations, and data flow diagrams.
- Familiarity with tools such as JIRA, Confluence, and business process modeling tools.

Preferred qualifications for the role include:

- Experience in Agile/Scrum methodologies.
- Background in domains such as fintech, e-commerce, or SaaS platforms.
- Exposure to SQL and understanding of relational databases.
- Experience working with API management platforms like Apigee or Mulesoft.

Additionally, the company requires candidates to have an MBA degree and 1 to 3 years of relevant experience. The position is based in Bangalore (Whitefield) and follows a work-from-office mode.,

title: FS-RC-BT INS-Business Analyst/Consultant
description:
EY is seeking a highly motivated and experienced FS-RC-BT INS-Business Analyst/Consultant to join their Data Science & Analytics department. This full-time, permanent position offers the opportunity to work on impactful projects within the insurance sector, specifically focusing on group benefits and retirement. The ideal candidate will leverage their expertise to provide valuable insights and drive strategic solutions for clients.

Key Responsibilities

Lead and manage consulting projects for US group benefit and retirement clients, ensuring timely delivery and high-quality outcomes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze client needs, develop tailored solutions, and implement best practices.
Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify trends and opportunities within the insurance sector.
Develop and present comprehensive reports and recommendations to clients, showcasing insights and actionable strategies.
Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their business challenges and providing expert guidance.
Mentor and support junior consultants, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented team environment.
Stay updated on industry developments, regulatory changes, and emerging trends to provide informed consulting services.

Qualifications / Requirements

MBA from a reputable institution is required.
3 to 8 years of experience in business consulting, with a focus on the insurance sector, particularly group benefits and retirement.
Strong domain knowledge of insurance processes, products, regulations, and market dynamics.
Proven consulting skills, including project management, analytical thinking, and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and persuasively.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Preferred Skills / Attributes

Experience with insurance processing and understanding of insurance products.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and identify key insights.
Experience in competitive analysis and market research within the insurance industry.
Project management experience, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Proven ability to build and maintain strong client relationships.

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
Description

The opportunity:

To ensure that IT solutions align with business objectives and deliver measurable value by managing requirements, coordinating with Project Teams, while overseeing end-to-end delivery and validating solution quality.

How you’ll make an impact:
• Collaborate with IT Service Managers, Application Managers, Solution Architects and Project Managers to deliver Integration Projects.

title: T&T- Customer- M&C-Analyst | SFMC-Business Analyst | Bengaluru
description:
Your potential, unleashed.

India’s impact on the global economy has increased at an exponential rate and Deloitte presents an opportunity to unleash and realise your potential amongst cutting edge leaders, and organisations shaping the future of the region, and indeed, the world beyond.

At Deloitte, your whole self to work, every day. Combine that with our drive to propel with purpose and you have the perfect playground to collaborate, innovate, grow, and make an impact that matters.

What impact will you make?

Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. As the undisputed leader in professional services, Deloitte is where you’ll find unrivaled opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential

Deloitte is where you’ll find unrivaled opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

The Team

Deloitte Digital has created a new model for a new age: the creative digital consultancy. We're transforming the digital journey in a way an agency or traditional consultancy alone cannot–now leaders across their entire organization can come to one place to have their ambitions brought to life. We combined the creative and digital capabilities of our studios and the broad reach of an advertising agency with the technical experience, deep business strategy, and relationships of one of the world's largest consultancy to create something that is so much more than the sum of its parts. We can help you imagine bigger and scale as your business grows. Learn more about Digital
• *Job Title:** Junior Business Analyst

--

### Role Overview

The Junior Business Analyst supports the analytics and project teams by gathering requirements, documenting processes, and assisting in the delivery of data‑driven solutions. This entry‑level position is ideal for recent graduates or candidates with 0‑2 years of analytical experience who are eager to develop strong business‑analysis skills in a fast‑moving environment.

---

### Key Responsibilities

- **Requirement Elicitation & Documentation**

- Participate in stakeholder interviews, workshops, and observation sessions.

- Capture functional and non‑functional requirements in clear, concise documentation (e.g., user stories, use cases, requirement specs).

- **Process Mapping & Analysis**

- Create and maintain process flowcharts, swim‑lane diagrams, and SOPs using tools such as Visio, Lucidchart, or Draw.io.

- Identify gaps, inefficiencies, and improvement opportunities in current workflows.

- **Data Support**

- Assist senior analysts with data extraction, cleansing, and basic analysis using Excel, SQL, or Power BI/Tableau.

- Prepare simple dashboards and reports to visualize key performance indicators (KPIs).

- **Testing & Validation**

- Support the creation of test plans, test cases, and conduct functional testing.

- Track and log defects, and verify resolutions with development teams.

- **Project Coordination**

- Maintain requirement traceability matrices and update project status trackers.

- Communicate progress, risks, and issues to the project team and stakeholders.

- **Documentation & Knowledge Management**

- Store and organize project artefacts in the team’s repository (e.g., Confluence, SharePoint).

- Contribute to the development of best‑practice guidelines and templates.

---

### Required Qualifications

- Strong analytical mindset with the ability to break down complex problems into actionable steps.

• Knowledge of process‑mapping tools (Visio, Lucidchart) | • Ability to work collaboratively in cross‑functional teams

• Understanding of Agile/Scrum basics (user stories, backlog grooming) | • Quick learner, openness to feedback

Education:B.Tech

How you’ll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help build world-class skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Centre.

Benefits

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.

Our purpose

Deloitte is led by a purpose: To make an impact that matters.

Every day, Deloitte people are making a real impact in the places they live and work. We pride ourselves on doing not only what is good for clients, but also what is good for our people and the

Communities in which we live and work—always striving to be an organization that is held up as a role model of quality, integrity, and positive change. Learn more about Deloitte's impact on the world

Recruiter tips

We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

Provide consultation to client stakeholders and business users in omni-channel-specific business topics, including product catalog modelling, inventory management, pricing strategy, shipping & freight, taxes, international commerce, customer service.
Applies advanced functional | technical principles, theories, and concepts related to requirements, data, usability and processes analysis.
Direct the configuration and maintenance of project team collaboration space and issue/task management system (Confluence, JIRA, etc.).
Experience in Prioritization of requirements, improving process efficiency, given feedback and collaborating with Sales, IT, Legal and Marketing team.
Experience in BRD, SRS, FRD, User manuals, DB Mapping docs.
Experience working in Waterfall and AGILE -SCRUM methodologies.
Ability to draft Use Case Diagrams, Use case scenarios, Activity Diagrams, Test Scenarios, User stories.
Experience in Data Modeling, Flowcharts, Wireframes and Mockups using tools like Pencil, Balsamiq and MS Visio.
Experience in Giving Product Demo to the customers and clients and part 3rd party API Integration documentation and analysis.
Experience in E-commerce and Telecom domain.
Experience in collaborating for Business Case and creating RFP.
Experience in performing System Testing and UAT.
Project management tools like JIRA, PIER, CONFLUENCE, RALLY etc.

title: Business Analyst with Telecom Domain
description:
NTT DATA strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.

We are currently seeking a Business Analyst with Telecom Domain to join our team in Bangalore, Karnātaka (IN-KA), India (IN).

Responsible

•Ensure appropriate mapping of new product developments, capability enhancements and operational efficiency changes onto business processes.

•Partner with stakeholders and customers across the organisation to inform the product vision, strategy, features, and prioritisation

•Partner with stakeholders and customers on how we shape the products and how we make them a reality.

•Translate product roadmap features into well-defined requirements including features, user stories, and acceptance test criteria

•Contribute to the development of business change plans and benefits profiles

•Engage with stakeholders and relevant subject matter experts to identify, collate and understand the detailed business requirements behind an identified business problem or opportunity

•Work with cross-functional teams and various stakeholders, including analytics, design/ user experience, engineering, and user enablement

•Responsible for managing all aspects of product delivery, including managing scope and plan strictly against contract.

•Delivery - BA deliverables planning and management & workshop planning and facilitation

•Conducting impact assessment and supporting business change activities

•Preparing / Reviewing user acceptance test scenarios and scripts

Experience

•3+ years of experience in working with Telecom clients in the role of Business Analyst / Process Owner.

•3+ years full time project management delivering BSS projects in the telecom's domain.

•Proven Business Analysis / Business Process Modelling experience.

•Full understanding of Telecom OSS/BSS Processes

•Subject matter expertise in the B2B product domain (eg. Broadband, SIMO, Mobile Sharer, Mobile Devices) and how to develop solutions for the B2B market.

•Excellent detailed written and verbal communication skills, including some user interface documentation skills.

As a Global Top Employer, we have diverse experts in more than 50 countries and a robust partner ecosystem of established and start-up companies. Our services include business and technology consulting, data and artificial intelligence, industry solutions, as well as the development, implementation and management of applications, infrastructure and connectivity. We are one of the leading providers of digital and AI infrastructure in the world. NTT DATA is a part of NTT Group, which invests over $3.6 billion each year in R&D to help organizations and society move confidently and sustainably into the digital future. title: Business Analyst II, Financial Planning & Analysis, Shopbop
description:
Description

Shopbop is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to drive strategic financial planning and business optimization initiatives across the organization. This role will focus on developing financial models, conducting business performance analysis, and providing data-driven insights to support key business decisions. The successful candidate will be instrumental in building and maintaining sophisticated financial models that drive strategic planning, budgeting, and forecasting processes. They will work closely with multiple business units and cross-functional partners to optimize revenue opportunities, manage costs, and identify areas for business improvement. The role requires someone who can translate complex financial analyses into actionable insights for stakeholders across the organization.

Key job responsibilities
• Develop and maintain financial models to support business planning, forecasting, and strategic initiatives
• Create and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports to track business performance and identify trends
• Partner with business leaders to develop revenue forecasts and expense budgets
• Build and maintain dashboards to monitor key business metrics and KPIs
• Conduct variance analysis and provide insights on business performance against plans
• Support strategic initiatives through financial modeling, scenario analysis, and ROI assessment
• Perform market analysis and competitive benchmarking to identify business opportunities
• Analyze customer behavior and revenue trends to support growth strategies
• Develop and automate reporting solutions to improve efficiency and data accuracy
• Partner with cross-functional teams to drive process improvements and operational efficiency
• Support business cases for new initiatives with comprehensive financial analysis

Basic Qualifications
• 3+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
• 5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
• 3+ years of business or financial analysis experience
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent
• Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
• Experience with Excel
• Experience with SQL
• Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
• Strong understanding of financial statements and accounting principles
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience in IBM Cognos TM1/Planning Analytics work including system configuration, model building and developing reports or dashboards with TM1
• Experience using data visualization tools
• Experience in stakeholder management, dealing with multiple stakeholders at varied levels of the organization
• Experience using Oracle, or experience in solving complex business challenges by delivering accurate and timely financial models, analysis, and recommendations that have a proven impact on business (e.g., financial savings, operational improvements, or customer benefits)

Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. title: Business Analyst III -  Audio Visual (AV)
source: First Citizens Careers - First Citizens Bank
description:
Overview

This position performs complex data analysis to identify factors that affect business profitability, growth, and efficiency. Assesses a wide scope of business practices, information, and industry trends. Determines improvements or solutions to address identified issues. Prepares technical reports by examining and summarizing data and creates specifications to support business initiatives. May oversee the work of less experienced analysts or assist in special projects as needed.
• Data Analysis - Sources, compiles, and interprets data. Performs advanced data analysis, effectively communicating and directing analysis output.
• Operational Support - Provides support for business operations by responding to inquiries, identifying issues, and working to improve team practices. Assists in streamlining daily workflow for overall unit, resolving escalated matters where possible. Implements recommended modifications and enhancements. May serve as an analytics resource to wider organization or business units.
• Identifying Objectives - Determines business needs through complex analysis and reporting. Develops strategies to achieve company and department goals, and communicates these using specifications, project plans, or other forms of documentation.
• Reporting - Produces reports based on data analysis, industry trends, and process capabilities. Conveys patterns, problems, and areas of improvement. May develop process enhancements based on reporting.

Additionally:

The Audio Visual (AV) Business Analyst will work closely with the business, IT, Corporate Real Estate (CRE), Facilities, and AV third-party vendors to coordinate and successfully deliver AV solutions to First Citizen Bank’s offices and branches. The AV Business Analyst will be responsible for creating and maintaining key documentation and workflows - from procurement to hand off for implementation. They will be expected to lead meetings with the various teams and third-party vendors. Initiative, documentation, tracking and communication will be key to success in this role. This is a young department, and the Business Analyst will contribute to the ongoing development of processes.

Remote eligible.

Responsibilities
• General understanding of AV equipment and scope of work for AV installations in office and retail branch spaces.
• Work closely with the approved AV vendor.
• Track AV rooms throughout their project lifecycle for AV: (1) Room refresh, (2) Net new VC room requests, (3) CRE projects, (4) and Break / Fix room tickets.
• AV project lifecycle includes: (1) Site survey, (2) Proposal received, (3) Proposal review and sign off with AV engineer, customer, and or CRE/Facilities, (4) Manage TPRM and PO process, (5) AV drawing review, (6) Equipment order, (7) Installation schedule, (8) Final room sign off, (9) and Invoice payment processing.
• Work closely with AV Implementation Engineer.
• Submit tickets and track to create Outlook meeting rooms.
• Schedule room installation/commissioning – with FCB resources.
• Review BOM on quotes for accuracy.
• Work closely with CRE or Facilities for room construction.
• Manage Room Readiness for AV installation and commissioning.
• Heavy meeting schedule as part of the AV lifecycle.
• Weekly meeting with AV vendor for project status.
• Weekly meeting with AV vendor for contract reviews.
• Weekly meeting with AV vendor for new business opportunities.
• Vendor / customer meetings to review proposals, drawings, and installation schedule.
• Manage TPRM and PO Process
• Enter approved proposals into Archer (TPRM portal).
• SOW contract review to finalize proposal for signature.
• Track approvals.
• PR/PO process in Coupa.
• Provide accounting coding for equipment, room installation, and room device maintenance and support.
• Track approvals to final PO issued.
• Inform vendor and customer when PO received.
• Excellent communication skills demonstrated through leading meetings, emails, spreadsheet tracking, dashboard tracking, and peers.
• Work through AV room backlog list.
• Take over existing projects: 30 locations with 176 rooms currently in flight.
• Digital signage for branches.
• Tracking room warranty schedule. Responsible to keep rooms on support.

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree and 4 years of experience in AV coordination or IT business analyst, or High School diploma or GED and 8 years of experience in AV coordination or IT business analyst.
• Background in project coordination.
• Knowledge of AV systems for office and retail branch spaces. Preferred Cisco AV equipment knowledge.
• Knowledge of contracts and Statement of Work (SOWs)..
• Excel and Word proficiency. Ability to update information and ability to set up new spreadsheets and Word documents.
• Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively to business and technical audiences.
• Demonstrated ability to think critically.

The base pay for this position is generally between $85,000 and $130,000. Actual starting base pay will be determined based on skills, experience, location, and other non-discriminatory factors permitted by law. For some roles, total compensation may also include variable incentives, bonuses, benefits, and/or other awards as outlined in the offer of employment.

This job posting is expected to remain active for 45 days from the initial posting date listed above. If it is necessary to extend this deadline, the posting will remain active as appropriate. Job postings may come down early due to business need or a high volume of applicants

title: Business Analyst
description:
SUMMARY: Assist the management, marketing, finance and business development functions of the Company to identify and document business growth opportunities.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: The incumbent may be required to perform all, or a combination of the following essential functions as determined by business necessity;

Develop in-depth knowledge of Microline's customers, products, and capabilities. Identify trendsetter ideas by researching industry and related events, publications, and announcements. Locate and propose prospective business deals by conducting research and discovering and exploring potential opportunities. During the research phase identify potential business deals by analyzing market strategies, deal requirements, and organizational, financial and customer impact. Develop financial models to assist in evaluating options consistent with strategic objectives by understanding business needs and goals. Collaborate with staff to help create roadmaps that intersect with customer needs. Provide product benchmarking and positioning by conducting ongoing competitive analysis to compare Microline's products with that of the competition. NON-ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: In addition to the essential functions listed above, the incumbent may be required to perform other non-essential functions. Employees are required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties as requested by their supervisor.

QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor degree or candidate for Bachelor or Master degree in business, life sciences or equivalent. Working knowledge of MS Offfice suite of products (Excel, Word, Powerpoint) with strong financial modeling skills. Strong research capabilities and demonstrated ability and drive to provide professional presentations. Strong interpersonal, presentation, communication (verbal and written) and influencing skills. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION: Microline Surgical is committed to the spirit and letter of the Americans with Disabilities Act and, as required by law, will reasonably accommodate otherwise qualified individuals.

title: Business Analyst, Expert
description:
Requisition ID # 168547

Job Category: Business Operations / Strategy

Job Level: Individual Contributor

Business Unit: Gas Operations

Work Type: Hybrid

Job Location: San Ramon

Position Summary:

Business Analysts are responsible for research, data analysis, budgeting, forecasting and reporting in support of business decision making, business strategy and business operations. May also be involved in business process improvement, quality control and special projects and other initiatives.

Responsibilities typically include many or all the following:

•Data Analysis: Compiles and analyzes data. May develop and/or maintain data models for what-if analysis and for other business purposes.

•Metrics and Reporting: Develops and tracks business metrics. Develops and maintains standard, custom and ad-hoc reports.

•Budgeting & Forecasting: Develops or works with budgets and forecasts.

•Research: Researches best practices; develops internal and external benchmarks in support of business decisions.

•Quality Assurance & Business Process Improvement: May perform quality assurance and business process improvement activities in support of the business. Activities may include developing, managing or coordinating performance or quality assessment, business process re-engineering, change management, communication and training.

•Project Management: Lead projects, determining scope, budget, timeframes, forming teams, assigning tasks, managing resources and issues.

Job Responsibilities:

•Performs analysis on highly complex data models that have cross- functional impact.

•Applies advanced knowledge to wide-ranging issues.

•Develops innovative data solutions to address complex business issues. Presents findings and proposed recommendations to leaders.

•Develop business cases in support of strategy or change initiatives.

•Works with and leverages relationships with Directors and Managers across functions / PG&E.

•Manages cross-functional projects or initiatives.

•May provide direction and coaching to other Business Analysts

This position is hybrid, working from your remote office and your assigned work location based on business need. The assigned work location will be within the PG&E Service Territory.

This job is also eligible to participate in PG&E’s discretionary incentive compensation programs

PG&E is providing the salary range that the company in good faith believes it might pay for this position at the time of the job posting. This compensation range is specific to the locality of the job. The actual salary paid to an individual will be based on multiple factors, including, but not limited to, specific skills, education, licenses or certifications, experience, market value, geographic location, and internal equity. Although we estimate the successful candidate hired into this role will be placed towards the middle or entry point of the range, the decision will be made on a case-by-case basis related to these factors.

A reasonable salary range is:

Bay Area Minimum: $114,000.

Bay Area Maximum: $182,000.

&/OR

California Minimum: $108,000.

California Maximum: $173,000.

Qualifications:

Minimum:

•BS in Business, Finance, Economics, Engineering or related discipline

•6 of related work experience

Desired:

•MBA or graduate degree

•Extensive knowledge of different analytical methods, approaches and tactics

•Broad expertise in what-if modeling analysis, concepts, methods and techniques and analysis of how different factors affect business outcomes

•Creative problem-solving skills to develop solutions

•Strong analytical and writing skills to create compelling business cases based on complex business environments and inputs

•Influence skills to effectively gain buy in from leaders inside and outside of the department Knowledge and understanding of key drivers affecting business results

title: Business Systems Analyst 22363-1
description:
Apply now: Business Systems Analyst, location is Hybrid (Atlanta, GA or Silver Springs, MD). The start date is September 10, 2025 (or 2 weeks from offer) for this 1-year contract position.

Job Title: Business Systems Analyst
Location-Type: Hybrid Atlanta, GA or Silver Springs, MD (3 days onsite)
Start Date Is: September 10, 2025 (or 2 weeks from offer)
Duration: 1 year (Contract, potential extension and conversion)
Compensation Range: $50.00/hr – $60.00/hr W2

Job Description:
We are seeking a Business Systems Analyst to support enterprise-wide business process initiatives during a large-scale restructuring effort. This role involves discovering, documenting, and consolidating existing process artifacts, mapping them across organizational and technical domains, and ensuring continuity until handoff to a new BPM practice in 2026. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with process model management, stakeholder facilitation, and enterprise BPM tools.

Job Responsibilities

Client, document, and consolidate existing enterprise-scale business process artifacts (e.g., content lifecycle, P2P).

Map processes to organizational units, technologies, and regions in LeanIX to support restructuring decisions.

Maintain and steward process artifacts through the restructuring period, ensuring continuity until hand-off to a new BPM practice in 2026.

Facilitate workshops with stakeholders to validate process–technology–organization views.

Must Have Skills / Requirements
• Experience with Process Model Management
• 5 years of experience; Curate a portfolio of process models performing discovery, collation, and promotion activities.
• Experience with Cross-Domain Mapping
• 5 years of experience; Mapping processes to business and technical contexts such as business capabilities and applications.
• Experience with Stakeholder Facilitation
• * 5 years of experience; Ability to work with both senior business leaders and technical stakeholders.
• * Focus on alignment, listening, and understanding needs.

Technology Requirements:

1) Expertise with operating an enterprise scale BPM tool. (Signavio, etc.)

2) ServiceNOW APM/SPM/CMDB experience or exposure.

3) SAP LeanIX experience or exposure.

4) Colibra or Apptio exposure.

Nice to Have Skills
• Experience working with a modern business outcome driven enterprise architecture team.

Soft Skills:

1) Experience with Process Modelling

2) Experience with Cross-Domain Mapping

3) Experience with Stakeholder Facilitation

title: Software Administration Business Analyst II
description:
Job Description

Mission Support and Test Services, LLC (MSTS) manages and operates the Nevada National Security Site (NNSS) for the U.S. National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA). Our MISSION is to help ensure the security of the United States and its allies by providing high-hazard experimentation and incident response capabilities through operations, engineering, education, field, and integration services and by acting as environmental stewards to the Site’s Cold War legacy. Our VISION is to be the user site of choice for large-scale, high-hazard, national security experimentation, with premier facilities and capabilities below ground, on the ground, and in the air. (See NNSS.gov for our unique capabilities.) Our 2,750+ professional, craft, and support employees are called upon to innovate, collaborate, and deliver on some of the more difficult nuclear security challenges facing the world today.
• MSTS offers our full-time employees highly competitive salaries and benefits packages including medical, dental, and vision; both a pension and a 401k; paid time off and 96 hours of paid holidays; relocation (if located more than 75 miles from work location); tuition assistance and reimbursement; and more.
• MSTS is a limited liability company consisting of Honeywell International Inc. (Honeywell), Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. (Jacobs), and HII Nuclear Inc.

Responsibilities

The Information Technology directorate is looking for a Business Process Analyst II to join the Project Management team.

Key Responsibilities
• Process software requests (ServiceNow).
• Ensure adherence to strict software licensing requirements.
• Work closely with deskside engineers to download requested software and ensure asset tracking is up to date.
• Proactively work to ensure annual maintenance agreements are in place prior to downloading any software.
• Conduct analysis of business information systems using applied knowledge and principals (systems approach) and assists in determining appropriate solution for problems.
• Assist in collecting, assembling and analyzing requirements to meet the needs of the organization.
• Assist with project documentation, the management of project schedule and budget.
• May meet with process owner and team members to ensure all requirements are met.
• Assist the organizational representative with defining requirements.
• May collect, assemble and analyze requirements to meet the needs of the organization.
• May assist with project documentation.
• May perform data entry and processes request for information through reporting capabilities.
• May coordinate or participate in project tasks, such as testing and end-user training.
• Assist with communication to all levels of the organization.
• Perform other duties as assigned by Management.

Qualifications

Due to the nature of our work, US Citizenship is required for all positions.
• Bachelor’s degree in a related field or two (2) years equivalent training and experience.
• Previous project management experience and responsibilities may be helpful.
• Critical Thinking & Problem Solving: Evaluates alternatives and identifies solutions using systematic, multi-step approaches.
• Collaboration: Facilitates discussion and resolves conflicts.
• Achieves customer satisfaction.
• Seeks advice from more senior project managers.
• Decision-Making: Demonstrates effective decision-making skills, including knowledge of how and when to escalate issues to higher levels. Analyzes the risks and future impact of decisions.
• Experience with Sharepoint, Microsoft Project and PowerBI is helpful.
• Knowledge of Flexera software tracking system is helpful.
• Working knowledge of ServiceNow incident tracking.
• The primary work location will be at the Losee Road facility in North Las Vegas, Nevada.
• Work schedule will be 4/10s Monday through Thursday (subject to change).
• Pre-placement physical examination, which includes a drug screen, is required. MSTS maintains a substance abuse policy that includes random drug testing.
• Must possess a valid driver’s license.

Ability to obtain a HSPD-12 Personal Identity Verification credential under the Department of Energy Order 206.2, ‘Identity, Credential, and Access Management,’ and Supplemental Directive NNSA SD 206.2, ‘Implementation of Personal Identity Verification for Uncleared Contractors.’

title: Software Business Analyst
description:
Description:Space is a critical domain, connecting our technologies, our security and our humanity. While others view space as a destination, we see it as a realm of possibilities, where we can do more — we can innovate, invest, inspire and integrate our capabilities to transform the future.

At Lockheed Martin Space, we aim to harness the full potential of space to cultivate innovation, reduce costs, and push the boundaries of what technology can achieve. We’re creating future-ready solutions, focusing on resiliency and urgency through our 21st Century Security® vision. We’re erasing boundaries and forming partnerships across industries and around the world. We’re advancing spacecraft and the workforce to fuel the next generation. And we’re reimagining how space can connect us, ensuring security and prosperity.

Join us in shaping a new era in space and find a career that's built for you.

Lockheed Martin Space is looking for a Business Analyst to support the FBM program. Candidate will work in a team environment to deliver custom applications to meet our customers’ needs. The candidate will be responsible for requirement gathering, customer engagement, and testing software solutions for our internal customers in the aerospace industry.

• Excellent communication and presentation skills
• Strong background on all aspects of the software development life cycle

• Organizing and executing Integration Test and User
Acceptance Test activities
• Providing the business with innovative solution to meet their current and future needs

• Agile Methodologies and Agile Tools

• Software Requirements and Use Case development

US Citizenship Required and the ability to obtain and maintain a secret clearance

• Software Product Backlog Management

title: Business Analyst Mid
description:
A client of Innova Solutions is immediately hiring for a Data Scientist Engineer

Position type: Full-time, Contract

Duration: 12 months with possible extension

Location: Baltimore MD/Washington District Of Columbia Hybrid

Position: AI & Machine Learning Scientist – Vision, GenAI & Azure Deployment

We’re on the hunt for a visionary Data Scientist who thrives at the intersection of deep learning, computer vision, and generative AI. If you’re passionate about building neural networks that see, hear, and understand—and deploying them seamlessly in the cloud—this is your playground.

What You’ll Be Creating & Innovating

? Deep Learning & Neural Architectures
• Architect and train cutting-edge models using TensorFlow, PyTorch, and transformer-based frameworks.
• Tackle complex vision tasks—object detection, segmentation, tracking—using UNet, YOLO, RCNN, SAM, DeepSORT, and more.
• Dive into multimodal generative models like Stable Diffusion, ControlNet, and CLIP to build intelligent systems that understand both images and language.
• Fine-tune pre-trained models for real-world applications across text, image, and audio.
• Optimize inference on high-performance NVIDIA GPUs (A100, H100).
• Build context-aware LLMOps pipelines for smart chat applications using Python.

? API Engineering & Integration
• Design robust RESTful and gRPC APIs for seamless model serving and data access.
• Own the API lifecycle—versioning, documentation, and security.
• Integrate with internal and external systems using FastAPI and other Python frameworks.

?? Cloud-Native AI on Azure
• Leverage Azure Machine Learning to orchestrate model training and deployment.
• Build and manage Azure Container Apps, Docker images, and registries.
• Host AI services and dashboards via Azure Web Apps.
• Automate CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Actions for smooth, scalable updates.

What You Bring to the Table

Must-Haves
• Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, or a related quantitative field.
• 5+ years of Python development with a strong focus on deep learning.
• Hands-on experience with Hugging Face, transformers, and custom model training.
• Proven success deploying models on GPU infrastructure.
• Solid grasp of API design and microservices architecture.
• Experience with Azure, Docker, and GitHub Actions.
• A problem-solving mindset and collaborative spirit.

Nice-to-Haves
• PhD in a relevant field.
• Experience with computer vision and multimodal generative AI.
• Familiarity with MLOps tools and workflows.
• Contributions to open-source AI projects or published research.

Qualified candidates should APPLY NOW for immediate consideration! Please hit APPLY to provide the required information, and we will be back in touch as soon as possible.

We are currently interviewing to fill this and other similar positions. If this role is not a fit for you, we do offer a referral bonus program for referrals that we successfully place with our clients, subject to program guidelines. ASK ME HOW.

Thank you!

Himanshu Kumar

614-918-0083

himanshu.kumar@innovasolutions.com

Pay Range*: $70.00 - $75.86 per hour
• Pay range offered to a successful candidate will be based on several factors, including the candidate's education, work experience, work location, specific job duties, certifications, etc.

Benefits: Innova Solutions offers benefits( based on eligibility) that include the following: Medical & pharmacy coverage, Dental/vision insurance, 401(k), Health saving account (HSA) and Flexible spending account (FSA), Life Insurance, Pet Insurance, Short term and Long term Disability, Accident & Critical illness coverage, Pre-paid legal & ID theft protection, Sick time, and other types of paid leaves (as required by law), Employee Assistance Program (EAP).

ABOUT INNOVA SOLUTIONS:Founded in 1998 and headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, Innova Solutions employs approximately 50,000 professionals worldwide and reports an annual revenue approaching $3 Billion. Through our global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe, we deliver strategic technology and business transformation solutions to our clients, enabling them to operate as leaders within their fields.
