title: Solution Architect - MDG
description:
About Us

Syniti, part of Capgemini, tackles the hardest work in data for the world’s largest organizations. We combine intelligent software with deep data expertise to help the Fortune2000 tackle complex data challenges and drive measurable business outcomes with business-ready data.

Syniti’s Data First strategy transforms data from an afterthought into a strategic asset—unlocking insights, reducing risk, and fueling growth. With over 5,000 successful projects, we support the full data lifecycle through a unified platform for migration, quality, replication, matching, master data management, analytics, governance, and strategy.

Operating globally across industries, Syniti’s award-winning software, expert consultants give enterprises a unique edge in managing and maximizing their data.

Must-Have:-
• ABAP Technical expertise. (OOABAP, WORKFLOWS, FPM-WEBDYNPRO)
• Business Rule Framework (BRF +) hands on experience
• Hands-on SAP MDG experience in SAP MDG-S / SAP MDG – C / SAP MDG –F / SAP MDG – M/ SAP EAM/ SAP RFM
• Minimum 2 implementation in SAP MDG covering inbound and out bound integration, designing custom data model and UIs for SAP MDG
• Detail understanding of SAP ERP master data
• Lead business requirement, functional and non-functional requirement gathering for SAP MDG projects
• Lead MDG architecture design and implementation of MDG projects
• Ability to provide SAP MDG training and hand-on sessions to team member
• Basic knowledge of SAP MDG Integration with Information steward / BO / NW MDM components
• Implementation knowledge of business context viewer, data quality dash board integration in SAP MDG UIs
• Detailed functional and technical knowledge of SAP MDG (version 9.2) on S4/Hana with at least 5 years’ experience using an SAP MDG platform
• Knowledge of master data management, data quality principles and design patterns (especially: Customer, Vendor and Material master data)
• SAP ECC configuration experience

[Work Location: India-Remote]

Job Description
• Minimum three end to end implementation of SAP MDG in material/customer/vendor/finance master data model
• Good understanding of SAP MDG
• Execution of master data vision and strategy; processes and tools for the project.
• Drive continuous improvement of data governance and data maintenance processes for implementing countries/entities
• Develop processes, tools and integration for Master Data Processes to support the project including data cleansing and data validation.
• Mapping of Master Data and integration from the legacy environment to the target environment
• Serve as key leader for the MDG implementation project
• Extensive SAP master data/integration related experience
• Ability to present and technical or new concepts across multiple levels of a global organization
• Knowledge/experience of interfacing SAP with legacy systems
• Plan, design and lead MDG components of business initiatives
• Provide advice and support for the definition of data standards across master data domains
• MDG process modelling, configuration, customization and master data design
• Collate, evaluate and priorities new MDG requirements / enhancements
• Prepare functional specifications, configuration and training documentation
• Provide input and support for the development of Testing/Training materials
• Problem solving - issue analysis and resolution
• Co-ordinate MDG Team for the execution of development and system support activities.
• Drive continuous improvement of MDM processes utilizing the latest capabilities of the MDG platform

What We Offer
• Trust that you are good at what you’re doing. At Syniti you will find a supportive environment and access to learning tools, but micromanagement is not our thing.
• Growth. We are growing rapidly and steadily solving the biggest challenges enterprise companies are faced with today. There was never a better time to join and grow with us. Most importantly you will have the chance to shape our journey and share in our success story.
• Support. We all rely on each other and enable each other to be successful. You won’t stand alone.
• Curiosity and genuine interest in you. We all have our different stories, all equally fascinating with each depicting a different journey and we want to hear them all.
• Recognition. We are the sum of individual achievements and we always take the time to celebrate them.
• An open organisation. Hierarchies are not our thing and access is something we make sure of across the board. We are a family where everyone is just as important, everyone’s work is seen and ideas valued.

title: Power Platform Architect
description:
Job Role : Power Platform Architect

Location: Bangalore, Hyderabad and Chennai

Exp: 8-12 years

Job Overview

We are seeking a talented and experienced Power Platform Architect to join our Pre-Sales and Solutions Team. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Microsoft Power Platform, including Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and Dataverse. You will be responsible for designing solutions, providing technical expertise, and supporting our sales team in demonstrating the value of our solutions to potential clients.

Key Responsibilities
• Solution Design: Architect and design custom solutions using Microsoft Power Platform to address the specific needs and challenges of our clients.
• Technical Expertise: Provide in-depth technical knowledge and expertise to support pre-sales activities, including presentations, demonstrations, and proof-of-concept projects.
• Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to understand their business requirements, gather technical requirements, and develop tailored solutions.
• Sales Support: Work closely with the sales team to create compelling proposals, respond to RFPs, and showcase the capabilities of the Power Platform.
• Market Awareness: Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends, best practices, and advancements in the Power Platform and related technologies.

Required Experience & Skills
• Experience: Minimum of 10+ years in the IT industry and minimum of 5 years of experience working with Microsoft Power Platform, including hands-on experience with Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, Dataverse, Power Pages and Copilot studio.
• Technical Skills: Strong understanding of cloud computing, data integration, and application development. Proficiency in Power Platform, Dynamics 365, and Azure services include Azure AI Services.
• Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Problem Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proactive attitude towards addressing challenges and finding innovative solutions.
• Experience integrating Power Platform with Dataverse, SharePoint, Azure services, and other enterprise applications.

Preferred Skills
• Prior experience in consulting or enterprise digital transformation projects.
• Microsoft Power Platform certification (PL -600 - Power Platform Solution Architect Expert)
• Knowledge of additional Microsoft technologies such as Azure and Dynamics 365.
• Expertise on other low code platform such as Mendix, Outsystems, Appian or PEGA

title: Digital Solution Architect (Java)
description:
You will be working as a Digital Solution Architect at a leading MNC Service-based company with 10 to 15 years of experience. The role is based in Bangalore and Chennai with a work mode of WFO.

As a Digital Solution Architect, you will design and architect web solutions to provide a seamless omni-channel user experience. Your focus will be on evaluating and selecting modern technologies and tools to enhance customer engagement and drive conversions through various techniques like Micro Frontends, AEM/AEP, AI, Machine Learning, and Cloud-Native platforms. You will be responsible for translating business requirements into innovative, scalable, and effective technical solutions. Collaborating closely with product stakeholders, you will lead solution design and development activities using Agile methodologies.

- Design and architect web solutions for seamless omni-channel user experience
- Evaluate and select modern technologies to enhance customer engagement
- Translate business requirements into scalable technical solutions
- Lead solution design and development activities using Agile methodologies
- Partner with cross-functional teams for consistent delivery of enterprise-level solutions
- Monitor and report delivery metrics and identify improvement opportunities
- Drive process improvement initiatives and implement best practices
- Stay updated with the latest advancements in web technologies and customer experience innovations

- Strong hands-on experience in Java/J2EE, Microservices architecture, and enterprise application development
- Proficiency in Next.js, ReactJS, NoSQL databases (e.g., Cassandra), Redis, and Elasticsearch
- Demonstrated success in designing solutions for large-scale enterprise systems
- Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot real-time challenges
- Exceptional communication skills to explain technical concepts to diverse audiences
- Experience in leading cross-functional teams and managing product lifecycle effectively
- Ability to design complex conversational flows and craft engaging user experiences
- Proven track record in analyzing delivery metrics for continuous improvement

If you have hands-on experience with PEGA, exposure to GenAI and personalization technologies, practical experience with AWS and Google Cloud platforms, and familiarity with ForgeRock Access Gateway and identity management solutions, it will be considered a good-to-have skill.,

title: Principal Solution Architect, IT Software [T500-20676]
description:
ANSR is hiring for one of its clients.

About American Airlines:

To Care for People on Life's Journey®. Together with our American Eagle regional partners, we offer thousands of flights daily to more than 350 destinations in more than 60 countries.

American Airlines is transforming the way it delivers technology to its customers and team members worldwide.

American’s Tech Hub in Hyderabad, India, is our latest technology office location and home to team members who drive technical innovation and engineer unrivalled digital products to best serve American’s customers and team members. With U.S. tech hubs in Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas and Phoenix, Arizona, our new team in Hyderabad, India enables better support of our 24/7 operation and positions American to deliver industry-leading technology solutions that create a world-class customer experience.

Intro:

Are you ready to explore a world of possibilities, both at work and during your time off? Join our American Airlines family, and you’ll travel the world, grow your expertise and become the best version of you. As you embark on a new journey, you’ll tackle challenges with flexibility and grace, learning new skills and advancing your career while having the time of your life. Feel free to enrich both your personal and work life and hop on board!

Why you’ll love this job:
• As one diverse, high-performing team dedicated to technical excellence, you will focus relentlessly on delivering unrivaled digital products that drive a more reliable and profitable airline.
• The Software domain refers to the area within Information Technology that focuses on the development, deployment, management, and maintenance of software applications that support business processes and user needs while ensuring reliability, performance, and security. This includes development, application lifecycle management, requirement analysis, QA, security & compliance, and maintaining the applications and infrastructure.

What you’ll do:

As noted above, this list is intended to reflect the current job but there may be additional essential functions (and certainly non-essential job functions) that are not referenced. Management will modify the job or require other tasks be performed whenever it is deemed appropriate to do so, observing, of course, any legal obligations including any collective bargaining obligations.
• Writes, tests, and documents technical work products (e.g., code, scripts, processes) according to organizational standards and practices
• Delivers high quality work and coaches team members on technical craftsmanship
• Conducts root cause analysis to identify systemic problems and defines and leads execution of action items to address
• Designs thoughtfully integrated systems that model organizational best practices, allowing disparate teams across product domains to deliver value with speed, scale, and reliability
• Oversees the management of technical debt in existing systems and drives opportunities to eliminate within ongoing implementations
• Consistently anticipates scaling, latency, and durability challenges and guides teams in implementation of mitigating strategies
• Partners with the security organization to incorporate security conscious practices early in the lifecycle of new systems
• Thoughtfully evaluates technical risks and guides toward practical prevention strategies
• Consistently works across teams to break down silos and resolve problems collaboratively
• Builds and maintains strong relationships with engineering and product leaders as well as key vendors across span of influence to capitalize on synergies within related organizations
• Clearly translates technical strategy into implementable componentry within the context of the relevant business area
• Maintains a focus on removing the duplication of effort across teams and proactively identifies opportunities for reuse within their span of influence
• Mentors individuals on teams across their span of influence
• Ensures teams across their span of influence are directionally aligned on the engineering strategy of their product domain and leads cross-team efforts that advance and influence organizational strategy

All you’ll need for success:

Minimum Qualifications- Education & Prior Job Experience:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Technology, Information Systems (CIS/MIS), Engineering or related technical discipline, or equivalent experience/training
• 8+ years of experience designing, developing, and implementing large-scale solutions in production environments
• Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Technology, Information Systems (CIS/MIS), Engineering or related technical discipline, or equivalent experience/training

Preferred Qualifications- Education & Prior Job Experience:
• Airline Industry experience

Skills, Licenses & Certifications:

Proficiency with the following technologies:
• Programming Languages: Java, Python, C#, Javascript/Typescript
• Frameworks: Spring/SpringBoot, FastAPI
• Front End Technologies: Angular/React
• Deployment Technologies: Kubernetes, Docker
• Source Control: GitHub, Azure DevOps
• CICD: GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps
• Data management: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis
• Integration/APIs Technologies: Kafka, REST, GraphQL
• Cloud Providers such as Azure and AWS
• Ability to optimize solutions for performance, resiliency and reliability while maintaining an eye toward simplicity
• Ability to concisely convey ideas verbally, in writing, in code, and in diagrams
• Ability to optimize system designs spanning multiple teams to allow small, safe, incremental releases
• Ability to work through others by cooperatively sharing responsibilities
• Ability to combines deep knowledge of a product domain with awareness of advancing technology to introduce solutions that propel the technical capability of the organization forward.
• Proficiency in object-oriented design techniques and principles
• Proficiency in Agile methodologies, such as SCRUM
• Proficiency in DevOps Toolchain methodologies, including Continuous Integration and
• Continuous Deployment

Language, Communication Skills, & Physical Abilities:
• Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and written with all levels within the organization
• Physical ability necessary to safely and successfully perform the essential functions of the position, with or without any legally required reasonable accommodations that do not pose an undue hardship. Note: If the Company has reason to question an employee’s physical ability to safely and/or successfully perform the position’s essential job functions, the HR team generally will engage in an interactive process to determine whether a reasonable accommodation is appropriate. HR (working with the operation) ordinarily first speaks with the team member directly and they mutually identify the physical demands of the job that are or may be impacted by the employee’s obvious or known condition. Then, if necessary, HR would request medical documentation from the team member’s treating physician or others to confirm the employee’s ability to perform those essential job functions safely and successfully.

What you’ll get:

Feel free to take advantage of all that American Airlines has to offer:
• Travel Perks: Ready to explore the world? You, your family and your friends can reach 365 destinations on more than 6,800 daily flights across our global network.
• Health Benefits: On day one, you’ll have access to your health, dental, prescription and vision benefits to help you stay well. And that’s just the start, we also offer virtual doctor visits, flexible spending accounts and more.
• Wellness Programs: We want you to be the best version of yourself – that’s why our wellness programs provide you with all the right tools, resources and support you need.
• 401(k) Program: Available upon hire and, depending on the workgroup, employer contributions to your 401(k) program are available after one year.
• Additional Benefits: Other great benefits include our Employee Assistance Program, pet insurance and discounts on hotels, cars, cruises and more

Feel Free to be yourself at American:

From the team members we hire to the customers we serve, inclusion and diversity are the foundation of the dynamic workforce at American Airlines. Our 20+ Employee Business Resource Groups are focused on connecting our team members to our customers, suppliers, communities and shareholders, helping team members reach their full potential and creating an inclusive work environment to meet and exceed the needs of our diverse world.

Are you ready to feel a tremendous sense of pride and satisfaction as you do your part to keep the largest airline in the world running smoothly as we care for people on life’s journey? Feel free to be yourself in America.

Competencies:
• Caring
• Collaboration
• Development
• Results
• Future

title: Data Platform Architect Hyderabad (India)
description:
Project Role : Data Platform Architect
Project Role Description : Architects the data platform blueprint and implements the design, encompassing the relevant data platform components. Collaborates with the Integration Architects and Data Architects to ensure cohesive integration between systems and data models.
Must have skills : PySpark
Positive to have skills : Snowflake Data Warehouse, AWS Athena, AWS Glue
Minimum 3 year(s) of experience is required
Educational Qualification : 15 years full time education

Summary: As a Data Platform Architect, you will be responsible for architecting the data platform blueprint and implementing the design, which includes various relevant components of the data platform. Your typical day will involve collaborating with Integration Architects and Data Architects to ensure seamless integration between systems and data models, while also addressing any challenges that arise during the implementation process. You will engage in discussions with team members to refine the architecture and ensure that it meets the evolving needs of the organization, all while maintaining a focus on best practices and innovative solutions. Roles & Responsibilities: - Expected to perform independently and become an SME. - Required active participation/contribution in team discussions. - Contribute in providing solutions to work related problems. - Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation of the data platform architecture and design. - Evaluate and recommend recent technologies and tools to enhance the data platform capabilities. Professional & Technical Skills: - Must To Have Skills: Proficiency in PySpark. - Good To Have Skills: Experience with Snowflake Data Warehouse, AWS Athena, AWS Glue. - Robust understanding of data modeling concepts and best practices. - Experience with ETL processes and data integration techniques. - Familiarity with cloud-based data solutions and architectures. Additional Information: - The candidate should have minimum 3 years of experience in PySpark. - This position is based at our Hyderabad office. - A 15 years full time education is required.

15 years full time education

title: Application Solution Architect
description:
Role Overview:
As an Application Solution Architect at Wipro Limited, you will be responsible for defining strategies, patterns, standards, and reference architectures for one or more domains. You will provide architecture leadership, mentoring, escalation, and resource allocation to the Fraud architecture team. Your role will involve defining solution architecture and design, presenting and seeking practical approaches that optimize cost and reuse while adhering to platform roadmaps and overall enterprise architecture. It will be crucial for you to articulate and communicate the solution architecture and design to business and engineering teams, as well as partner with external suppliers to define architecture patterns and integration approaches. Additionally, you will lead Architecture governance, advocate strategic architecture and design patterns, manage risks effectively, stay updated with technology trends, and conduct design reviews of other team members for alignment with architecture principles and strategy.

Key Responsibilities:
- Define strategies, patterns, standards, and reference architectures for one or more domains
- Provide architecture leadership, mentoring, escalation, and resource allocation to the Fraud architecture team
- Define solution architecture and design, optimizing cost and reuse while adhering to platform roadmaps and overall enterprise architecture
- Articulate and communicate the solution architecture and design to business and engineering teams
- Partner with external suppliers to define architecture patterns and integration approaches
- Lead Architecture governance and advocate strategic architecture and design patterns
- Manage risks effectively, including timely and efficient management and escalation of risks and issues
- Stay up to date with technology trends and communicate to peers and stakeholders
- Perform design reviews of other team members for alignment with architecture principles and strategy

Qualification Required:
- Mandatory Skills: Enterprise Architecting
- Experience: More than 10 years

In addition, Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company with a holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, and operations. With over 230,000 employees and business partners across 65 countries, Wipro is dedicated to helping customers, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world. To learn more, visit www.wipro.com. Join Wipro and be part of a business powered by purpose where you can design your own reinvention and contribute to building a modern Wipro that is an end-to-end digital transformation partner with bold ambitions.,

title: Cloud Solution Architect
description:
Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced and customer-centric Cloud Solutions Architect to support presales engagements and delivery execution for our North American clients. This position requires working 2 PM – 10 PM IST to align with US business hours. The role demands deep AWS cloud architecture expertise with strong presales solutioning capabilities, while maintaining working knowledge of other cloud platforms and modern data/AI workloads.

Key Responsibilities

Presales & Solution Engineering

Engage with US-based enterprise customers to understand business objectives, technical challenges, and cloud transformation needs.

Design and propose AWS-native architectures across compute, storage, networking, and security.

Develop high-impact solution blueprints, technical proposals, and reference architectures tailored to client requirements.

Lead RFP/RFI responses, customer demos, and technical workshops.

Collaborate with Sales, Product, and Delivery teams to align solutions with business outcomes.

Conduct Proof-of-Concepts (PoCs) to validate and de-risk proposed solutions.

Delivery & Execution

Ensure seamless transition of solutions from presales to delivery.

Provide technical leadership during project execution, including architecture reviews, implementation guidance, and troubleshooting.

Support cloud adoption best practices: performance tuning, cost optimization, and security compliance.

Act as a bridge between client stakeholders, delivery teams, and project managers.

Technical Expertise

Core Focus (AWS Cloud & Infra)

IaaS: EC2, VPC, S3, EBS, ELB, Auto Scaling

PaaS: RDS, Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, Aurora, Fargate, Step Functions

Security & SaaS: IAM, Organizations, WAF, GuardDuty, CloudTrail

Secondary Skills (lighter requirement)

Multi-Cloud Awareness: Azure (Synapse, AKS), GCP (BigQuery, GKE)

DevOps & Automation: Terraform, CloudFormation, Jenkins, GitOps, CI/CD pipelines

Data & AI/ML Exposure: Data lakes, Redshift, Kinesis, Glue, Athena; basic familiarity with SageMaker, MLOps practices

Required Skills & Qualifications

Bachelor’s/Master’s in Computer Science, IT, or related discipline.

10+ years in IT with 5+ years in cloud architecture & presales/delivery roles.

AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Professional (preferred).

Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, comfortable presenting to CXOs, architects, and engineering teams.

Ability to translate business requirements into scalable, secure, and cost-effective architectures.

Nice to Have

Industry vertical experience in finance, healthcare, or retail cloud transformations.

Familiarity with container orchestration (EKS, AKS, GKE).

Exposure to MLOps frameworks (Kubeflow, MLflow).

Shift & Location

Work Hours: 2:00 PM – 10:00 PM IST (to support US-based clients)

title: Azure Fabric Solution Architect
company: RiDiK (a Subsidiary of CLPS. Nasdaq: CLPS)
description:
As an Azure Fabric Solution Architect, you will be responsible for designing and implementing data solutions within Azure. With over 15 years of experience in data architecture and engineering, you will leverage your expertise in Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure Fabric to deliver efficient and scalable solutions. Your hands-on experience with ETL processes, data modeling, and pipeline optimization will be crucial in ensuring the success of data projects.

Key Responsibilities:
- Designing and implementing data solutions within Azure using Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure Fabric.
- Developing ETL processes, data modeling, and pipeline optimization for efficient data processing.
- Utilizing SQL, Python, or Spark for data processing and transformation.
- Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure data governance, security, and compliance best practices.
- Working with Azure DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, and version control for seamless solution delivery.
- Applying strong analytical and problem-solving skills to address data-related challenges.
- Managing multiple priorities in agile, fast-paced environments.

Qualifications Required:
- 15+ years of experience in data architecture, engineering, or solution design within Azure.
- Proficiency in SQL, Python, or Spark for data processing and transformation.
- Knowledge of Azure DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, and version control.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a detail-oriented mindset.
- Excellent communication and collaboration skills in cross-functional teams.
- Ability to work in agile, fast-paced environments and manage multiple priorities.
- Preferred Azure certifications such as Azure Solutions Architect Expert or Azure Data Engineer Associate.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals and you are an immediate joiner, we encourage you to apply by sending your resume to Rajalaxmi.nayak@ridik.net. Please include the following details:
- Current Salary
- Expected Salary
- Notice Period
- Total Years of Experience
- Relevant work experience

We look forward to hearing from candidates who are passionate about leveraging Azure technologies to drive impactful data solutions.,

title: Amgen - Data Architect
description:
Job Posting Title: Data Architect

Workday Job Profile: Principal IS Architect

Department Name: Digital, Technology & Innovation

Role GCF: 06A

ABOUT AMGEN

Amgen harnesses the best of biology and technology to fight the world's toughest diseases, and make people's lives easier, fuller and longer. We discover, develop, manufacture and deliver innovative medicines to help millions of patients. Amgen helped establish the biotechnology industry more than 40 years ago and remains on the cutting-edge of innovation, using technology and human genetic data to push beyond what's known today.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Role Description:

The role is responsible for developing and maintaining the data architecture of the Enterprise Data Fabric.- Data Architecture includes the activities required for data flow design, data modeling, physical data design, query performance optimization.

The Data Architect is a senior-level position responsible for developing business information models by studying the business, our data, and the industry. This role involves creating data models to realize a connected data ecosystem that empowers consumers. The Data Architect drives cross-functional data interoperability, enables efficient decision-making, and supports AI usage of Foundational Data. - This role will manage a team of Data Modelers.

Roles & Responsibilities:

- Provide oversight to data modeling team members.

- Develop and maintain conceptual logical, and physical data models and to support business needs

- Establish and enforce data standards, governance policies, and best practices

- Design and manage metadata structures to enhance information retrieval and usability

- Maintain comprehensive documentation of the architecture, including principles, standards, and models

- Evaluate and recommend technologies and tools that best fit the solution requirements

- Evaluate emerging technologies and assess their potential impact.

- Drive continuous improvement in the architecture by identifying opportunities for innovation and efficiency

Basic Qualifications and Experience:

- Doctorate Degree and 2 years of experience in Computer Science, IT or related field- OR

- Master's degree with 8 - 10 years of experience in Computer Science, IT or related field- OR

- Bachelor's degree with 10 - 14 years of experience in Computer Science, IT or related field- OR

- Diploma with 14 - 18 years of experience in Computer Science, IT or related field

Functional Skills:

Must-Have Skills :

- Data Modeling: Expert in creating conceptual, logical, and physical data models to represent information structures.

- Ability to interview and communicate with business Subject Matter experts to develop data models that are useful for their analysis needs.

- Metadata Management: Knowledge of metadata standards, taxonomies, and ontologies to ensure data consistency and quality.

- Information Governance: Familiarity with policies and procedures for managing information assets, including security, privacy, and compliance.

- Hands on experience with big data technologies and platforms, such as Databricks, Apache Spark (PySpark, SparkSQL), performance tuning on big data processing

Good-to-Have Skills:

- Experience with Graph technologies such as Stardog, Allegrograph, Marklogic

Professional Certifications

Certifications in Databricks are desired

Soft Skills:

- Excellent critical-thinking and problem-solving skills

- Strong communication and collaboration skills

- Demonstrated awareness of how to function in a team setting

- Demonstrated awareness of presentation skills

Shift Information:

This position requires you to work a later shift and may be assigned a second or third shift schedule. Candidates must be willing and able to work during evening or night shifts, as required based on business requirements.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Ekloud - Data Architect
description:
Description

About the Role :

We are seeking a highly experienced and technically adept Data Architect to design and deliver enterprise-grade data architecture solutions that power analytics, AI, and business intelligence initiatives. The ideal candidate will possess deep expertise in data modeling, cloud-native data platforms (Azure/AWS), and data governance frameworks, with a strong focus on building scalable, secure, and high-performance data ecosystems. This role demands a hands-on architect with a passion for modern data technologies, distributed processing, and end-to-end data lifecycle management.

Key Responsibilities

Enterprise Data Architecture Design :
• Architect and implement large-scale data ecosystems that enable analytics, AI, and ML-driven decision-making across the organization.
• Define and enforce data architecture standards, design patterns, and best practices to ensure consistency and scalability.

Data Modeling
• Develop and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models aligning with enterprise data strategy.
• Ensure that data structures are optimized for performance, quality, and compliance.

Data Platform Engineering
• Design and manage data lakes, data warehouses, and lakehouse environments using Azure Synapse, Databricks, AWS Redshift, or Snowflake.
• Architect and optimize ETL/ELT pipelines using tools such as Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue, or custom solutions with Python/Spark.

Data Governance & Compliance
• Establish and maintain data governance frameworks, metadata management, and data lineage tracking.
• Ensure compliance with data privacy and regulatory frameworks such as GDPR, HIPAA, and SOC 2.
• Collaborate with InfoSec teams to implement data security, access control, and encryption standards.

Cloud & Modern Data Stack Integration
• Design cloud-native architectures leveraging scalable storage, compute, and orchestration solutions.
• Integrate modern data stack components such as dbt, Airflow, Kafka, Power BI, Tableau, and APIs for seamless data flow and analytics enablement.

Performance Optimization & Automation
• Leverage Python and Apache Spark for distributed data processing, automation, and performance tuning.
• Implement CI/CD pipelines for data integration and deploy data quality monitoring frameworks.

Collaboration & Leadership
• Partner with data engineers, AI/ML engineers, business analysts, and product teams to align data initiatives with organizational goals.
• Mentor technical teams and drive adoption of data-driven design principles and architectural best practices.

Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Expertise :
• Strong proficiency in SQL, Python, and Apache Spark for large-scale data engineering.
• Hands-on experience with Azure Synapse, Databricks, AWS Redshift, or Snowflake.
• Solid understanding of ETL/ELT processes, data warehousing, and data lake architectures.
• Experience in designing scalable, event-driven data architectures and implementing real-time data streaming (Kafka, Kinesis, or Event Hubs).

Architectural & Strategic Skills
• Deep understanding of data modeling (3NF, star schema, data vault) and data lifecycle management.
• Proven experience architecting data platforms on cloud ecosystems (Azure or AWS).
• Familiarity with data mesh and lakehouse paradigms and modern data fabric design.

Governance & Compliance
• Knowledge of data governance, master data management (MDM), and metadata management tools.
• Experience implementing data lineage and observability frameworks.
• Awareness of regulatory compliance (GDPR, HIPAA, PCI DSS).

Soft Skills
• Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
• Proven ability to collaborate with business and technical stakeholders.
• Leadership experience in driving architecture reviews and mentoring data teams.

Preferred Qualifications
• Certification in Azure Data Engineer Associate, AWS Data Analytics Specialty, or Snowflake Data Architect.
• Experience with AI/ML model data pipelines and data product architecture.
• Exposure to Kubernetes, Terraform, and CI/CD frameworks for data infrastructure automation.

(ref:hirist.tech)

title: AWS Data Architect - Python/Apache Airflow
description:
Role : AWS Data Architect

Job Description :

Candidate should possess a deep understanding of big data technologies, cloud services, and data architecture, with a proven track record of leading data-driven projects to successful completion.

Key Responsibilities :

- Lead a team of data engineers, providing technical guidance and mentorship.

- Develop and execute a strategic roadmap for data processing, storage, and analytics in alignment with organizational goals.

- Design, implement, and maintain robust data pipelines using Python and Airflow, ensuring efficient data flow and transformation for analytical and operational purposes.

- Utilize AWS services, including S3 for data storage, Glue and EMR for data processing, and orchestrate data workflows that are scalable, reliable, and secure.

- Implement real-time data processing solutions using Kafka, SQS, and Event Bridge, addressing high-volume data ingestion and streaming needs.

- Oversee the integration of diverse systems and data sources through AppFlow, APIs, and other integration tools, ensuring seamless data exchange and connectivity.

- Lead the development of data warehousing solutions, applying best practices in data modelling to support efficient data storage, retrieval, and analysis.

- Continuously monitor, optimize, and troubleshoot data pipelines and infrastructure, ensuring optimal performance and scalability.

- Ensure adherence to data governance, privacy, and security policies, implementing measures to protect sensitive data and comply with regulatory requirements.

Qualification :

- Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field.

- 8-10 years of experience in data engineering, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.

- Proficient in Python programming and experience with Airflow for workflow management.

- Strong expertise in AWS cloud services, particularly in data storage, processing, and analytics (S3, Glue, EMR, etc.).

- Experience with real-time streaming technologies like Kafka, SQS, and Event Bridge.

- Solid understanding of API based integrations and familiarity with integration tools such as AppFlow.

- Deep knowledge of data warehousing concepts, data modelling techniques, and experience in implementing largescale data warehousing solutions.

- Demonstrated ability to lead and mentor technical teams, with excellent communication and project management skills.

title: Salesforce Solution Architect
description:
Role Description:

Define and design solution architecture for Salesforce solutions and project implementations. Conduct solution architecture reviews and recommend best practices for design and implementation of Salesforce solutions.

Responsibilities:
• Engage with customers to understand business requirements and proposed solutions to define and design optimal Salesforce solutions architecture
• Define the guidelines and best practices for architecting and designing Salesforce solutions
• Engage with Presales team for RFP reviews, support on solution design recommendations, effort estimations, proposal reviews and present solution proposals and demonstrations.
• Participate and support in design and development of pre-built solutions
• Engage with delivery teams and support on project implementations to define and design effective Salesforce solutions, provide architectural guidance and conduct solution reviews
• Architect robust solutions based on recommended best practices considering high performance, security, scalability and future upgrades/enhancements
• Conduct architecture reviews to validate solution design, recommend changes to align to desired business or technical objectives
• Develop deep functional and technical understanding of Salesforce products and solutions. Continuously enhance knowledge and skills on Salesforce products and solutions
• Conduct Solution architecture sessions for internal teams to share knowledge internally
• Conduct Solution architecture sessions for customers to showcase our skills and capabilities

Prerequisites:
• Highly motivated resource with excellent communications and presentation skills.
• Experience of presenting to senior leaders and C-level execs
• Solid technical and functional knowledge across Salesforce products and solutions
• Experience of architecting robust highly scalable, high performance Salesforce solutions integrated with other enterprise solutions like ERP, HCM, Middleware, Data warehousing, BI/AI
• Solid understanding of integration tools and methods
• Minimum 3 years of Solution architecture experience as a Salesforce Solution architect
• Hands-on project delivery experience of atleast 5 years and with large end-to-end project implementations for enterprise customers
• Total Experience of 10-15 years with atleast 5 years of Salesforce experience
• Must have Salesforce Certification(s). Atleast 1 Architect certification preferred
• Sound understanding of SDLC, Agile/DevOps methodologies and Salesforce DX
• Team player. Works collaboratively with sales, presales and delivery teams

Desired Skills and Experience:
• Experience of other enterprise class solutions like ERP, HCM, Middleware, DW, BI/AI
• Experience of working / integrating with other Salesforce products e.g. Einstein Analytics, Mulesoft, Heroku, Tableau
• Experience of working and engaging with customers in Europe, Middle East and India regions
• Experience in Financial Services, Health, Government, Retail/CG industries preferred
• Highly aware of industry trends and latest developments on CRM solutions

Location: Hyderabad

title: IN_Director _ SAP Solution Architect _Enterprise APP SAP_ Advisory _ Hyderabad
description:
Line of Service

Advisory

Industry/Sector

Not Applicable

Specialism

SAP

Management Level

Director

Job Description & Summary

At PwC, our people in business application consulting specialise in consulting services for a variety of business applications, helping clients optimise operational efficiency. These individuals analyse client needs, implement software solutions, and provide training and support for seamless integration and utilisation of business applications, enabling clients to achieve their strategic objectives.

As a SAP consulting generalist at PwC, you will focus on providing consulting services across various SAP applications to clients, analysing their needs, implementing software solutions, and offering training and support for effective utilisation of SAP applications. Your versatile knowledge will allow you to assist clients in optimising operational efficiency and achieving their strategic objectives.
• Why PWC

At PwC, you will be part of a vibrant community of solvers that leads with trust and creates distinctive outcomes for our clients and communities. This purpose-led and values-driven work, powered by technology in an environment that drives innovation, will enable you to make a tangible impact in the real world. We reward your contributions, support your wellbeing, and offer inclusive benefits, flexibility programmes and mentorship that will help you thrive in work and life. Together, we grow, learn, care, collaborate, and create a future of infinite experiences for each other. Learn more about us .

At PwC, we believe in providing equal employment opportunities, without any discrimination on the grounds of gender, ethnic background, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, religion or other beliefs, perceived differences and status protected by law. We strive to create an environment where each one of our people can bring their true selves and contribute to their personal growth and the firm’s growth. To enable this, we have zero tolerance for any discrimination and harassment based on the above considerations. "

Job Description & Summary : A career within Advisory line of service at PwC for SAP Practice

Responsibilities:

1) Solution Architecture & Design · Define and own end-to-end SAP architecture spanning S/4HANA (On-Prem or Cloud, Public/Private), SAP BTP, Integration Suite, and key LoBs (FI/CO, MM, SD, PP, QM, EWM, TM, IBP, Ariba, SuccessFactors, CX, GRC). · Translate business capabilities into target-state architecture, process maps, and solution roadmaps (incl. brownfield/greenfield paths). · Create solution blueprints, interface catalogs, data models, and RICEFW objects design (Reports, Interfaces, Conversions, Enhancements, Forms, Workflows). 2) Implementation & Governance · Lead fit-gap analysis, process harmonization, and global template design; define localizations (GST/India e-invoicing, e-way bill, etc.). · Govern configuration standards, extensions (in-app, side-by-side on BTP), and custom code remediation. · Drive migration strategy (LTMC/LSMW or modern tools), data quality, and cutover planning. · Define non-functional requirements (performance, scalability, resiliency, availability, observability). 3) Integration & Data · Architect integrations via API/ODATA, IDoc/ALE, RFC, events; design patterns on SAP Integration Suite, CPI, PO, or middleware (MuleSoft, Boomi, Informatica). · Ensure Master Data governance (MDG), data lineage, data security, and retention policies. · Establish analytics architecture (SAC, DWC, BW/4HANA, CDS views) incl. KPIs and semantic models. 4) Security, Compliance & Risk · Define Authorization/B SoD/GRC models and secure-by-design principles. · Ensure compliance with audit, data privacy, and regulatory (SOX, GDPR, Indian GST) requirements. · Conduct security design reviews and penetration readiness (with InfoSec). 5) Delivery Leadership · Provide technical leadership to functional consultants, developers, and integration teams. · Establish architecture guardrails, design review boards, and DevSecOps practices (transport management, CI/CD pipelines). · Vendor/partner management and effort estimation for projects and enhancements. 6) Stakeholder & Change Management · Collaborate with business owners to prioritize backlog, define acceptance criteria, and ensure adoption. · Create L1–L4 process documentation, training collateral, and transition plans for support.
• Support RFPs, solution demos, and reference architectures for pre-sales (as required)

Mandatory skill sets:

10–15+ years in SAP with at least 5+ years in architecture/lead roles. Deep hands-on across S/4HANA (preferably 2021/2022/2023 or Cloud editions) and at least two end-to-end implementations. Expertise in one or more domains (choose based on your need): · Finance (FI/CO, Group Reporting, Central Finance) · Supply Chain (MM, SD, EWM, TM, GTS, IBP) · Manufacturing (PP/DS, QM, MES integration) · Procurement (Ariba, SLC) · HR (SuccessFactors) · Customer Experience (SAP CX/Emarsys) Strong knowledge of SAP BTP, extensions (CAP, RAP), and Integration Suite. Proficiency in process modeling (BPMN, Event-Driven) and solution documentation (Archimate/UML, SAP Signavio optional). Experience with cloud platforms (Azure/AWS/GCP) and networking/security integrations (SSO, SAML, OAuth). Familiarity with DevOps/Transport pipelines (Azure DevOps/Jenkins), testing frameworks (CBTA, Tricentis), and performance tuning. Excellent stakeholder communication, analytical thinking, and decision-making under ambiguity.

Preferred skill sets:

10–15+ years in SAP with at least 5+ years in architecture/lead roles. Deep hands-on across S/4HANA (preferably 2021/2022/2023 or Cloud editions) and at least two end-to-end implementations. Expertise in one or more domains (choose based on your need): · Finance (FI/CO, Group Reporting, Central Finance) · Supply Chain (MM, SD, EWM, TM, GTS, IBP) · Manufacturing (PP/DS, QM, MES integration) · Procurement (Ariba, SLC) · HR (SuccessFactors) · Customer Experience (SAP CX/Emarsys) Strong knowledge of SAP BTP, extensions (CAP, RAP), and Integration Suite. Proficiency in process modeling (BPMN, Event-Driven) and solution documentation (Archimate/UML, SAP Signavio optional). Experience with cloud platforms (Azure/AWS/GCP) and networking/security integrations (SSO, SAML, OAuth). Familiarity with DevOps/Transport pipelines (Azure DevOps/Jenkins), testing frameworks (CBTA, Tricentis), and performance tuning. Excellent stakeholder communication, analytical thinking, and decision-making under ambiguity.

Years of experience required:

15+yrs

Education qualification : Btech MBA MCA MTECH

Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)

Degrees/Field of Study required: Master of Business Administration, Bachelor of Technology

Degrees/Field of Study preferred:

SAP Solution Architecture

Accepting Feedback, Accepting Feedback, Active Listening, Analytical Thinking, Application Software, Business Model Development, Business Process Modeling, Business Systems, Coaching and Feedback, Communication, Creativity, Developing Training Materials, Embracing Change, Emerging Technologies, Emotional Regulation, Empathy, Enterprise Integration, Enterprise Software, Implementation Research, Implementation Support, Implementing Technology, Inclusion, Influence, Innovation, Innovative Design {+ 30 more}

title: Senior Lead Architect - Data Architect
description:
Job Description

A career with us is a journey, not a destination. This could be the next best step in your technical career. Join us if you are excited about shaping the future of technology and driving significant business impact in financial services. Join our team and help us develop game changing, high-quality solutions.

As an Senior Lead Data Architect at JPMorgan Chase within the Home Lending division, you will be an integral part of a dynamic team dedicated to transforming the way we manage and utilize data. Our team is focused on developing innovative data architecture solutions that enhance our software applications and platform products. We are committed to leveraging modern data standards, best practices, and automation to maximize data use and transparency, minimize costs and efforts, and ensure compliance with regulations and internal controls as we migrate to the cloud.

Job Responsibilities
• Represent a product family in technical governance bodies and provide feedback to improve architecture governance practices.
• Guide the evaluation of current technology and lead the assessment of new technologies using existing standards and frameworks.
• Regularly provide technical guidance and direction to support the business and its technical teams, contractors, and vendors.
• Develop secure and high-quality production code, and review and debug code written by others.
• Drive decisions that influence product design, application functionality, and technical operations and processes.
• Serve as a function-wide subject matter expert in one or more areas of focus.
• Actively contribute to the engineering community as an advocate of firmwide frameworks, tools, and practices of the Software Development Life Cycle.
• Influence peers and project decision-makers to consider the use and application of leading-edge technologies.

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills
• Formal training or certification on Data Architect concepts and 5+ years applied experience in data domain
• Formal training or certification on Data Architect concepts and 10+ years applied experience in data domain.
• Hands-on practical experience delivering system design, application development, testing, and operational stability.
• Advanced proficiency in one or more programming languages, applications, and architecture.
• Advanced knowledge of software architecture, applications, and technical processes with considerable in-depth knowledge in one or more technical disciplines (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, mobile, etc.).
• Familiarity with data engineering tools, including spark,flink, streaming services, ETL/ELT tools, and analytical tools.
• Experience with AI/ML models especially Generative AI and agentic AI frameworks.
• Ability to tackle design and functionality problems independently with little to no oversight.
• Practical cloud-native experience.
• Ability to evaluate current and emerging technologies to select or recommend the best solutions for the future state architecture.
• Proven experience as an information architect or in similar capacity and data architecture tools, eg ERWIN, HACKOLADE

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills
• Prior experience with Chase systems and data structures.
• Excellent communication skills and leadership presence.
• Knowledge of artificial intelligence is preferred and considered an added advantage.
• Familiarity with data consumption and publishing industry patterns.
• Proficiency in using data architecture toolsets such as data modeling tools, ETL tools, and cloud platforms

ABOUT US

JPMorganChase, one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set and location. Those in eligible roles may receive commission-based pay and/or discretionary incentive compensation, paid in the form of cash and/or forfeitable equity, awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

JPMorgan Chase & Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Veterans

title: SOLUTION ARCHITECT – WEB APP DEVELOPMENT
description:
Overview

This is a full-time and work-from-office role for a Solution Architect in web application development. The Solution Architect will be responsible for solution architecture, consulting, software development, integration, and business process tasks to create far-reaching solutions for clients.

Total Experience

10+ Years

Job Skills
• 10+ years of experience in developing web apps
• Proven track record in creating business value for Organizations through technology solutions and Platform Implementations.
• In-depth knowledge of software architecture principles, design patterns, and architectural styles (eg, microservices, event-driven architecture) and hands-on experience in the implementation of Architecture patterns and styles.
• Proficiency in one or more programming languages (eg, Java, Python, C#) and familiarity with modern software development practices (Agile, DevOps, SAFE).
• Strong expertise in understanding business domains and tailoring technology solutions for business problems.
• Experience with cloud computing platforms (eg, AWS, Azure, GCP) and familiarity with cloud-native architectures.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think strategically and develop innovative solutions to business challenges.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
• Self-driven professional with the ability to work independently with Clients and deliver on Artifacts.

Responsibilities
• Requirement Analysis: Work closely with business stakeholders to gather and analyse requirements, ensuring a deep understanding of business processes, objectives, and challenges.
• Solution Design: Design end-to-end solutions that address business needs, leveraging appropriate technologies, architectures, and methodologies. Ensure solutions are scalable, flexible, and aligned with enterprise architecture standards.
• Technical Guidance: Provide technical guidance to development teams throughout the solution development lifecycle. Mentor team members on architecture best practices and design principles.
• Architecture Development: Develop and maintain architecture artifacts, including architectural diagrams, design documents, and technical specifications. Ensure consistency and coherence across the solution architecture.
• Application Development: Contribute towards Application development, Code reviews, and define and develop Architecture runway for new initiatives.
• Prototyping and Proof of Concept: Develop prototypes and proof-of-concept implementations to validate design concepts and demonstrate feasibility. Iterate on designs based on feedback and testing results.
• Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including development, infrastructure, operations, and security teams within the organization and customer organization to ensure seamless integration of components and alignment with objectives.
• Performance Optimization: Identify opportunities for performance optimization and scalability improvements within existing solutions. Implement optimizations to enhance system performance and reliability.
• Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in solution architecture. Continuously enhance knowledge and skills through self-study, training, and participation in professional communities.
• Contribute to New Business Opportunities: Provide solutions to RFPs received from clients and ensure overall design assurance. Contribute towards estimation for Tech Solution designed.

Apply Now

title: Millenium Data Architect (Remote)
description:
**Overview**

GovCIO is hiring an experiencedMilleniumData Architect with deepexpertisein cloud and network engineering to support modernization efforts for the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). This role focuses onidentifyingarchitectural migration patterns, resolving provisioning and schema challenges, and improving legacyVistAproducts. This position is fully remote,locatedin the United States.
• *Responsibilities**

+ Demonstrateexpertisein Millennium data modeling, including schema design and optimization.

+ Collaborate with data modelers to design scalable, normalized database architectures.

+ Apply deep knowledge of database theory and modeling concepts to support VA enterprise systems.

+ Lead the development of system conceptual designs and comprehensive documentation to ensure clarity, efficiency, and alignment with VAobjectives.

+ Define and implement system-level verification procedures and customer acceptance test protocols to ensure high-quality deliverables.

+ Review andvalidatetest plans and procedures, ensuring compliance with contractual and industry standards.

+ Conduct in-depth data analysis toidentifyarchitectural migration patterns and resolve dependencies.
• *Qualifications**

Bachelor's with 12+ years (or commensurate experience)
• *Required Skills and Experience**

+ Must havedata modeling and database theoryexpertise

+ Proficiency in automation tools and scripting (Python, Terraform, Ansible). 

+ Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with customers and internal cross-functional teams. 

+ Experience with virtual and/or cloud-based servers and applications. 

+ Excellent technical documentation and reporting skills. 

+ Experience working in an Agile environment.

+ Experience withMillenium Modelling

+ Experience using CDW, writing queries and familiarity with CDW data products

+ AWS Certified Advanced Networking - Specialty 

+ Microsoft Certified: Azure Network Engineer Associate 

+ Cisco CCNA or CCNP 
• *Company Overview**

GovCIO is a team of transformers--people who are passionate about transforming government IT. Every day, we make a positive impact by delivering innovative IT services and solutions that improve how government agencies operate and serve our citizens.

But we can't do it alone. We need great people to help us do great things - for our customers, our culture, and our ability to attract other great people. We are changing the face of government IT and building a workforce that fuels this mission. Are you ready to be a transformer?
• *What You Can Expect**

If you are selected to move forward through the process, here's what you can expect:

+ During the Interview Process

+ Camera must be on

+ A valid photo ID must be presented during each interview

+ During the Hiring Process

At GovCIO, we consistently hear that meaningful work and a collaborative team environment are two of the top reasons our employees enjoy working here. In addition, our employees have access to a range of perks and benefits to support their personal and professional well-being, beyond the standard company offered health benefits, including:

+ Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

+ Corporate Discounts

+ Learning & Development platform, to include certification preparation content

+ Training, Education and Certification Assistance*

+ Referral Bonus Program

+ Internal Mobility Program

+ Pet Insurance

+ Flexible Work Environment
• Available to full-time employees

Our employees' unique talents and contributions are the driving force behind our success in supporting our customers, which ultimately fuels the success of our company. Join us and be a part of a culture that invests in its people and prioritizes continuous enhancement of the employee experience.
• *We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.** All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. title: Data Architect
source: Sazerac Company | Careers | Sazerac Company - ICIMS
description:
Sazerac Company Overview

Build your career at Sazerac! With almost 400 years of rich history, Sazerac Company has thrived as an independent, American family-owned company with operations in the United States and around the world. Since the 2000s, Sazerac has averaged double digit growth every year! Sazerac Company produces and markets the most award-winning bourbons and whiskeys in the world, including Buffalo Trace, Pappy Van Winkle, Eagle Rare, Blanton’s, and Sazerac Rye. Additionally, Sazerac owns many popular brands across a range of spirits, including Fireball, Southern Comfort, Seagram’s V.O., Myers’s, Goldschläger, Parrot Bay, 99 Brand, and Platinum Vodka.

We’re proud of our award-winning culture and distilleries. Our Louisville office has been named one of the “Best Places to Work in Kentucky” four times, and our Buffalo Trace Distillery has earned the title of “world’s most award-winning distillery” through the dedication of our craftsmen for well over 200 years. Whether you’re a recent graduate or an experienced professional, Sazerac provides extraordinary opportunities for growth with competitive salaries and benefits in an exciting, entrepreneurial industry.

Job Description/Responsibilities

Bio: An experienced Data Architect with deep expertise in Microsoft Azure data services, along with strong working knowledge of Azure Synapse, Fabric, SQL Server, IBM DB2, and Cognos. This role is responsible for developing and governing enterprise-wide data architecture strategies to ensure consistency, quality, security, and accessibility of data across the organization. This team member will bring both technical depth and strategic vision to design scalable, modern, cloud-first data solutions aligned with business objectives. This position can be remote in AL, AR, DE, DC, FL, GA, IN, IA, KY, LA, ME, MD, MS, MO, NV, NH, NC, OH, OK, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, VA or WY.
• Use Performance Development System (PDS) to enhance performance within the company through evaluation, planning, and goal execution. Strive to constantly develop oneself as a valuable asset through personal and professional growth and attention to the position’s outcomes.
• Work closely with enterprise architects, data engineers, and governance teams to align data solutions with IT and business strategy. Provide leadership, and other functional areas, key measures against all performance based activities.
• Contribute to the overall company growth year over year by providing reliable data and support to all functions within the company.
• Provide data and systems that can be utilized by client groups to improve usability and thus team member’s efficiency of day to day activities. This will lead to improved business decisions and strategic planning.
• Define and enforce standards for data quality, data lineage, metadata management, and master data management (MDM). Lead architectural planning, data platform modernization, and migration of legacy systems (SQL Server, DB2) to Azure. Perform data architecture reviews and ensure alignment with security, privacy, compliance, and performance requirements.
• Develop and maintain canonical data models, conceptual/logical/physical data models, and metadata repositories. Design and own enterprise data architecture that supports both operational and analytical workloads across cloud and on-premise environments. Translate complex business needs into end-to-end data architecture that delivers high availability, data integrity, and scalability.
• Architect data integration pipelines and ELT/ETL frameworks using Azure Data Factory, Synapse Pipelines, and custom orchestration when needed. Participate in architecture governance forums and contribute to technology roadmaps and reference architecture blueprints.
• Ensure organization and proper time-management by following list of priorities and organizing tasks based on this list. Provide timely updates to team member or requestors. Provide weekly priority updates to manager, along with details of non-priority tasks completed.
• Serve as the SME on Azure Data Platform technologies: Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure SQL (Database/MI), Azure Data Lake Gen2, Azure Data Factory, Azure Purview or Microsoft Fabric, and Azure Databricks for advanced analytics and large-scale processing. Provide architectural guidance for reporting and analytics solutions, including optimization of Cognos reports and semantic models.

Qualifications/Requirements

MUST
• Strong analytical and technical skills
• Excellent oral & written communication skills
• Working knowledge of MS Office Products (Word, Excel and Outlook)
• Demonstrate the ability to work as a team as well as self-directed
• Ability to handle multiple tasks at one time
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
• Detail-oriented with strong organizational and project management skills.
• A proactive mindset and the ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment
• Innovative, analytical, solution-oriented mindset with problem solving and strategic thinking skills to evaluate and provide actionable insights
• 8 years years of experience in data architecture, enterprise data solutions, or large-scale analytics environments
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, or related discipline
• Extensive hands-on experience in: microsoft azure data services (synapse, adf, data lake, sql), microsoft fabric (lakehouse, real-time analytics), azure databricks, ibm db2, cognos analytics (report modeling, framework manager)
• Strong understanding of data security, encryption, rbac, and compliance in cloud environments
• Experience in enterprise data modeling (3nf, dimensional, data vault), data integration and transformation design, t-sql and db2 sql (procedures, indexing, tuning), metadata and data catalog design and usage
• Proven ability to bridge the gap between business goals and technical execution

PREFERRED
• Azure certifications such as: microsoft certified: azure data engineer associate, microsoft certified: azure solutions architect expert
• Experience with data governance tools (azure purview, informatica, collibra).
• Experience with enterprise bi tools beyond cognos (e.g., power bi). and integration with microsoft fabric and azure databricks
• Exposure to enterprise architecture frameworks (togaf, zachman) and data strategy initiatives
• Experience working with oracle fusion erp and informatica is preferred

title: AI and Data Strategy Architect
description:
Join phData, a dynamic and innovative leader in the modern data stack. We partner with major cloud data platforms like Snowflake, AWS, Azure, GCP, Fivetran, Pinecone, Glean and dbt to deliver cutting-edge services and solutions.We're committed to helping global enterprises overcome their toughest data challenges.

phData is a remote-first global company with employees based in the United States, Latin America and India. We celebrate the culture of each of our team members and foster a community of technological curiosity, ownership and trust. Even though we're growing extremely fast, we maintain a casual, exciting work environment. We hire top performers and allow you the autonomy to deliver results.
• 6x Snowflake Partner of the Year (2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025)
• Fivetran, dbt, Atlation, Matillion Partner of the Year
• #1 Partner in Snowflake Advanced Certifications
• 600+ Expert Cloud Certifications (Sigma, AWS, Azure, Dataiku, etc)
• Recognized as an award-winning workplace in US, India and LATAM

The AI & Data Strategy Architect, within the Advisory Practice, will be responsible for advising clients on how to utilize data and AI to drive business transformation and competitive advantage. This individual will create data and AI strategies aligned to client goals, design implementation roadmaps, and guide organizations through adoption of advanced data platforms, machine learning solutions, and responsible AI practices. The role demands strong executive presence, a deep understanding of cloud ecosystems and modern data architectures, and a proven ability to lead cross-functional teams. Additionally, the strategist will help build and expand the Advisory practice by developing offerings, cultivating client relationships, and mentoring high-performing teams in a rapidly evolving market

Required Experience:
• 8+ years as a hands-on AI & Data Strategy Leader who has led AI & Data Strategy engagements.
• 4+ years previous Consulting leadership experience working with external clients, with the ability to multitask, prioritize tasks, and work across a variety of projects.
• Understands the evolving AI capabilities in the industry, including their applications and how to leverage them effectively to help clients increase revenue, improve customer experience, or introduce new products to the market.
• Brings vertical/industry expertise to bear, in making Strategic recommendations, given the nuances of each industry, e.g. Financial Services, Healthcare, Retail.
• Experience engaging senior stakeholders, including members of the C-suite.
• Functional Strategy Leadership expertise and/or exposure, including:
• Identification and prioritization of business-focused opportunities.
• Expertly balancing technical, organizational, and process recommendations.
• Developing and sequencing long-term roadmaps.
• Designing future state operating models.
• Designing processes for effective data and analytical asset management.
• Developing business cases with return on investment in mind.
• Making recommendations that resonate with organizations, and have a clear story behind why we are making them.
• Adept at making technical recommendations that are tied to business outcomes, including but not limited to the following areas:
• Adept at making technical recommendations that are tied to business outcomes, including but not limited to the following areas:
• Cloud computing.
• Data platform development.
• Integration patterns.
• Data quality resolution.
• Data Governance.
• Privacy and security.
• Regulatory needs.
• Experience prioritizing use cases by value and complexity, conducting SWOT analysis, and bringing the confluence of capability and industry, to inform recommendations.
• Can communicate relatively technical concepts to a non-technical audience verbally clearly and concisely.
• Has facilitated discovery sessions and workshops, ensuring a focus on business value to keep all participants aligned on the objectives.
• Had led "art of the possible" sessions to bring insights into what other organizations are doing within an industry, and to inspire client stakeholders.
• Able to guide on technology rationalization decisions, taking into account criteria such as total cost of ownership (TCO) and business need in mind.
• Knowledge of industry-wide strategy frameworks, principles, and best practices.
• Knowledge of global privacy requirements, e.g. GDPR, CCPA.
• Proven ability to lead and manage a team of Business Analysts, Technical Architects, Data Engineers, and Change Leaders while fostering internal growth through coaching, mentoring, and performance management.
• Proven track record of collaborating with client stakeholders, technology partners, and cross-functional sales and delivery team members across distributed global teams, ensuring seamless, successful project delivery outcomes.
• Ability to create strong cross-practice relationships to drive customer success.
• Exhibits a strong sense of ownership in resolving challenges, committed to ensuring exceptional outcomes for all aspects of project execution.
• A vision for how the Data and AI industry is evolving, and the value that evolutions will bring to the organizations that we serve.
• Strong client-facing written and verbal communication skills and experience; ability to deliver presentations with compelling storylines, tailored to the target audience, from technical stakeholders through to executive teams.
• 4-year Bachelor's degree.

Why phData? We offer:
• Remote-First Work Environment
• Casual, award-winning small-business work environment
• Collaborative culture that prizes autonomy, creativity, and transparency
• Competitive comp, excellent benefits, 4 weeks PTO plan plus 10 Holidays (and other cool perks)
• Accelerated learning and professional development through advanced training and certifications

phData celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our approach helps us to build a winning team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. So, regardless of how your diversity expresses itself, you can find a home here at phData. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, genetic information, disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you would like to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at People Operations.

title: Data Governance Architect
description:
Overview

Data Governance Architect

The Data Architect Senior manages the development and implementation of organization-wide strategies for data storage, security, regulations and management to meet technical and business goals. Working under minimal supervision, the Data Architect Senior manages the projects and processes that revolve around the design and storage of databases to store and process confidential and sensitive data.

The Data Governance Architect will participate in and lead the following functions:
• Building policies, procedures, and automation to address the following:
• Data Quality and Integrity
• Classification and Cataloging of Data
• Data Security and Sharing
• Data Lineage
• Auditing
• Perform standard Program Management activities
• Perform ETL, Data Engineering and Platform Architecture activities to assist teams during times of high demand

Responsibilities:

Reviews data warehouses and data analytics systems to ensure they are functioning properly and are not susceptible to security breaches.

Develops strategies for data acquisition, data access, data archiving, and data recovery in order to create optimal data processes for both the organization and the users.

Examines data models and defines the structure, attributes, and nomenclature of data elements to enhance current systems.

Evaluates new data sources to ensure adherence to the organization's quality standards and policies.

Optimizes overall data and information flow by reducing redundancy and ensuring accessibility to improve efficiency.

Reviews new data sources to stay informed of industry trends and new emerging data storage and maintenance methodologies.

Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

EDUCATION:

Required: Bachelor's Degree

EXPERIENCE:

Required: 6 years
