title: Senior Data Architect-7380
description:
Contract Westbrook, Maine
• Location: Westbrook, Maine
• Type: Contract
• Job #20449
ProSearch is seeking a Senior Data Architect for a hybrid role based in Westbrook, Maine, to support a confidential client’s rapidly advancing global LIMS (Laboratory Information Management System) initiatives. In this position, you will design and architect cloud-native data pipelines, build scalable data solutions, and support near real-time data delivery across a fast-paced scientific research environment. This is a high-impact opportunity for a seasoned data architecture professional with strong experience in AWS, Apache Spark, Python, and modern data engineering practices.
Top Required Skills
• Hands-on experience building cloud-native data services and pipelines (not traditional ETL) using infrastructure-as-code and large-scale processing engines such as Apache Spark
• Strong expertise with SQL and at least one programming language (Python preferred)
• Exceptional problem-solving abilities and a proven track record of working independently
Nice-to-Have Skills
• Data modeling experience, including data warehouse and data lake architectures
• Knowledge of relational and non-relational databases (document stores, key-value stores, etc.)
• Experience working with AWS technologies such as S3, Glue, Lambda, Kinesis, IAM
• Experience with Snowflake
• Understanding of engineering best practices around SDLC, version control, and CI/CD
About the Role

As a Senior Data Architect, you will design, develop, and maintain scalable, fault-tolerant data pipelines and services that power critical diagnostics systems. You’ll be instrumental in improving near real-time data delivery, ensuring accuracy, performance, and reliability across the architecture.
This position reports to the Development Manager and operates within an Agile team environment, requiring close coordination with engineering, product, QE, and customer-focused partners.
Key Responsibilities
• Design and implement scalable, serverless data solutions using AWS services such as Glue and Lambda
• Develop and optimize data pipelines that support near real-time processing
• Collaborate with engineering and product teams to understand data requirements and deliver complete, reliable solutions
• Document data flows, architecture decisions, and metadata to ensure transparency and maintainability
• Build fault-tolerant systems that ensure high availability and resilience
• Partner with Quality Engineering to support testing and validation of data solutions
• Develop architecture that supports operational and business data needs across a global enterprise

Required Qualifications
• Strong analytical and independent problem-solving skills
• Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences
• Demonstrated experience building and maintaining operational data pipelines, especially streaming technologies such as AWS Kinesis
• Expertise with Apache Spark, Python, and Scala
• Solid background in AWS cloud services with an emphasis on serverless data processing
• Experience working with a broad range of technologies, including:
• Cloud-native data processing and analytics
• SQL and NoSQL databases (Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL, DynamoDB, MongoDB)
• Programming with Python and Scala
• Ability to translate complex business requirements into scalable, maintainable data solutions
• Strong organizational skills and ability to adapt to changing business priorities
Preferred Background
• Minimum 5+ years of experience in a similar data architecture or senior data engineering role
• Experience designing cloud-based data services and pipelines using infrastructure-as-code and large-scale processing engines
• Strong SQL skills and proficiency in at least one major programming language (Python preferred)

Location & Work Environment
• Hybrid schedule: Monday–Friday, 8am–5pm
• Office located in Westbrook, Maine
• Candidates must be in commuting distance or open to relocation

Success Metrics
• Consistent delivery of project milestones
• Improved data accuracy and system stability
• Reduction in pipeline failures or downtime through resilient design
• High stakeholder satisfaction across engineering, product, and customer-facing teams
• Meaningful contributions to Agile ceremonies and team velocity
• Proactive identification and mitigation of data risks, including security and compliance considerations

Why This Role Matters

Your work will directly support advanced research, diagnostics, and data-driven decision-making across a global scientific organization. You’ll have the opportunity to architect modern systems that improve real-time insight, scalability, and operational excellence, making a significant impact in the world of technology research.
Ready to Build What’s Next?

If you’re a Senior Data Architect who thrives in a technical, collaborative, and mission-driven environment, we’d love to meet you.
Apply now through ProSearch to be considered for this impactful career opportunity.

title: Solution Architect (Hybrid Work Schedule)
description:
Title: Solution Architect (Hybrid Work Schedule)

State Role Title: Salary Non-Specified

Hiring Range: $135,000 - $145,000

Pay Band: UG

Agency: Virginia Retirement System

Location: Virginia Retirement System

Agency Website: www.varetire.org/careers

Recruitment Type: General Public - G

Job Duties

The Virginia Retirement System is seeking a talented Solutions Architect to join our team. This role involves maintaining and administering the M365 platform and its associated applications. Overseeing the full lifecycle solution development, implementation, and maintenance using Microsoft 365 applications, Power Platform, SharePoint, Azure, and Copilot technologies. The Solution Architect works collaboratively with business users, fellow team members, managed services provider, and IT Security and Infrastructure team members in maintaining and supporting M365 platform and its components.

• Architects, designs, develops, and maintains applications using the Power Platform, SharePoint online, M365 Copilot, and Azure services to automate and upgrade enterprise business processes.
• Designs scalable and robust application architectures that meet business requirements.
• Utilizes Dataverse for data management, storage, and integration across various applications and services.
• Develops and maintains best practices, principles, and standards for M365 platform and applications.
• Collaborates with stakeholders to gather requirements, translate them into technical specifications.
• Creates and maintains comprehensive technical documentation, including design specifications, user manuals, and operational procedures.
• Develops and maintains M365 governance documentation.
• Manages M365 security, compliance, and governance. Ensures M365 platform settings and polices align with VRS Security Policies, Microsoft best practices, VITA Sec 530 and NITS 800-53 standards.
• Integrates M365 solutions with other enterprise systems and applications.
• Remains current on updates and new releases for M365 and related products and ensures compliance with license agreements.
• Designs and develops AI agents and bots and other relevant services.
• Develops and maintains enterprise dashboards and reports using Power BI.
• Troubleshoots and resolves technical issues related to M365 platform and related products.
• Provides technical support and mentorship to team members and colleagues.
• Performs other assigned duties.

Minimum Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in information systems, computer science, or a closely related field.
• Five (5) years’ experience in architecting, designing, and developing solutions using Power Platform, Azure, Machine Learning, or Copilot technologies.

Additional Considerations
• Working knowledge in Power Automate and SharePoint Online
• Strong understanding of M365 security, compliance, and governance.
• Working knowledge of DevOps practices and tools, such as Azure DevOps, and CI/CD pipelines
• Experience with Software Development Methodologies - Waterfall, Agile (Scrum) and hybrid approaches.

Demonstrated expertise and working knowledge in Power Automate, SharePoint Online, Teams, Copilot, Dataverse and Azure. Strong knowledge of AI and machine learning frameworks and technologies. Expertise in Dataverse for data management and integration. Strong understanding of M365 security, compliance, and governance. Experience with Azure services, including Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, and Azure SQL Database. Working knowledge of DevOps practices and tools, such as Azure DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, and version control systems (e.g., Git ). Experience with Software Development Methodologies - Waterfall, Agile (Scrum) and hybrid approaches.

Special Instructions

You will be provided a confirmation of receipt when your application and/or résumé is submitted successfully. Please refer to “Your Application” in your account to check the status of your application for this position.

VRS is unable to provide sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Applicants must have authorization to work in the United States without the need for sponsorship now or in the future.

The current hybrid schedule for technology employees is 3 days onsite (Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday) and 2 days remote (Monday and Friday). All employees must be able to work the current hybrid schedule and report to the office as needed on designated remote days.

Contact Information

Name: Human Resources

Email: careers@varetire.org

In support of the Commonwealth’s commitment to inclusion, we are encouraging individuals with disabilities to apply through the Commonwealth Alternative Hiring Process. To be considered for this opportunity, applicants will need to provide their AHP Letter (formerly COD) provided by the Department for Aging & Rehabilitative Services (DARS), or the Department for the Blind & Vision Impaired (DBVI). Service-Connected Veterans are encouraged to answer Veteran status questions and submit their disability documentation, if applicable, to DARS/DBVI to get their AHP Letter. Requesting an AHP Letter can be found at AHP Letter or by calling DARS at 800-552-5019.

Note: Applicants who received a Certificate of Disability from DARS or DBVI dated between April 1, 2022- February 29, 2024, can still use that COD as applicable documentation for the Alternative Hiring Process.

title: Sr. Data Architect
description:
About the position

Responsibilities
• Develop architectural solutions for new deals and major change requests in existing deals.
• Create an enterprise-wide architecture that ensures systems are scalable, reliable, and manageable.
• Provide solutioning of RFPs received from clients and ensure overall design assurance.
• Develop a direction to manage the portfolio of to-be-solutions including systems, shared infrastructure services, applications to better match business outcome objectives.
• Analyze technology environment, enterprise specifics, client requirements to set a collaboration solution design framework/architecture.
• Provide technical leadership to the design, development, and implementation of custom solutions through thoughtful use of modern technology.
• Define and understand current state solutions and identify improvements, options & tradeoffs to define target state solutions.
• Clearly articulate, document and sell architectural targets, recommendations and reusable patterns and propose investment roadmaps.
• Evaluate and recommend solutions to integrate with overall technology ecosystem.
• Work closely with various IT groups to transition tasks, ensure performance and manage issues through to resolution.
• Perform detailed documentation of the architectural design and solution mentioning all the artefacts in detail.
• Validate the solution/prototype from technology, cost structure and customer differentiation point of view.
• Identify problem areas and perform root cause analysis of architectural design and solutions and provide relevant solutions.
• Collaborate with sales, program/project, consulting teams to reconcile solutions to architecture.
• Track industry and application trends and relate these to planning current and future IT needs.
• Provide technical and strategic input during the project planning phase in the form of technical architectural designs and recommendations.
• Collaborate with all relevant parties to review the objectives and constraints of solutions and determine conformance with the Enterprise Architecture.
• Identify implementation risks and potential impacts.
• Enable Delivery Teams by providing optimal delivery solutions/frameworks.
• Build and maintain relationships with executives, technical leaders, product owners, peer architects and other stakeholders to become a trusted advisor.
• Develop and establish relevant technical, business process and overall support metrics (KPI/SLA) to drive results.
• Manage multiple projects and accurately report the status of all major assignments while adhering to all project management standards.
• Identify technical, process, structural risks and prepare a risk mitigation plan for all the projects.
• Ensure quality assurance of all architecture or design decisions and provide technical mitigation support to the delivery teams.
• Recommend tools for reuse, automation for improved productivity and reduced cycle times.
• Lead the development and maintenance of enterprise framework and related artefacts.
• Develop trust and build effective working relationships through respectful, collaborative engagement across individual product teams.
• Ensure architecture principles and standards are consistently applied to all projects.
• Support pre-sales team while presenting the entire solution design and its principles to the client.
• Negotiate, manage and coordinate with the client teams to ensure all requirements are met and create an impact of solution proposed.
• Demonstrate thought leadership with strong technical capability in front of the client to win confidence and act as a trusted advisor.
• Ensure completion of necessary trainings and certifications.
• Develop Proof of Concepts (POCs), case studies, demos for new growth areas based on market and customer research.
• Develop and present a point of view of Wipro on solution design and architect by writing white papers, blogs.
• Attain market referencability and recognition through highest analyst rankings, client testimonials and partner credits.
• Be the voice of Wipro's Thought Leadership by speaking in forums (internal and external).
• Mentor developers, designers and Junior architects in the project for their further career development and enhancement.
• Contribute to the architecture practice by conducting selection interviews.
• Anticipate new talent requirements as per the market/industry trends or client requirements.
• Hire adequate and right resources for the team.
• Ensure adequate onboarding and training for team members to enhance capability & effectiveness.
• Build an internal talent pool and ensure their career progression within the organization.
• Manage team attrition.
• Drive diversity in leadership positions.
• Set goals for the team, conduct timely performance reviews and provide constructive feedback to direct reports.
• Ensure that the Performance Nxt is followed for the entire team.
• Lead and drive engagement initiatives for the team.
• Track team satisfaction scores and identify initiatives to build engagement within the team.

Requirements
• Mandatory Skills: Snowflake
• Experience: 8-10 Years

Benefits
• Full range of medical and dental benefits options
• Disability insurance
• Paid time off (inclusive of sick leave)
• Other paid and unpaid leave options

title: Director of Solution Architecture
description:
JOB LEVEL
M60/P60

EMPLOYEE ROLE
People Manager

The Opportunity

Use your leadership expertise in solutions architecture to lead our Adobe on AEP Customer Zero engagement. This Director position will lead a team of solution architects focused on implementing technology solutions that drive business and customer growth for Adobe. This role will use Adobe’s Digital Experience suite of products/services, including large-scale data infrastructure, machine learning models, and a powerful personalization platform that delivers new capabilities for Creative, Document and Experience cloud. As the leader of solutions architecture, you will have significant responsibility and influence the future of data platforms at Adobe. The ideal candidate will have the ability to partner with product and growth teams to design solutions that last the test of time.
What you will do
• Deliver large-scale growth engineering projects many of which are implementations of Adobe Experience Cloud solutions
• Create a strong solution engineering culture where team members learn and grow while delivering measurable contributions to the business
• Lead deep discovery sessions with partner teams to understand their key business and technical needs
• Prepare and deliver compelling and scalable technical solutions design, engagement approach, and timelines
• Engage internal customers for feedback on platform capabilities that will inform the engineering roadmap
• Share standard processes and reference implementations with product engineering teams
What you will need
• 5+ years of experience as a technical people manager
• 12+ years of experience in technical/ business consulting, with at least 3+ years of hands- on experience with Adobe Solutions like Real Time CDP, Adobe Journey Optimizer, Customer Journey Analytics, and AEM
• Experience in leading workshops to define and prioritize client requirements and required Capabilities. Ability to drive clarity and alignment.
• Proven track record to design, architect, and optimize business processes and to integrate business processes across disparate systems.
• Ability to demonstrate concepts visually and in writing as the situation demands to guide partners in thinking through all aspects of the ask
• Strong background in leading large web-based systems, or complete software product lifecycle exposure
• Excellent communication/collaboration skills when it comes to leading and inspiring solutions engineers and partners
• Experience with both B2C and B2B subscription business model is a plus
• Certification (any type) in at least one of the following: Adobe Experience Platform or Adobe Journey Optimizer.

Deep understanding of web technologies like tag management systems, tagging and implementation methods, data collection methods, visitor identification methods and data layer design. Hands-on experience in implementation of one or more of the above-mentioned solutions.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $179,300 -- $354,600 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

State-Specific Notices:

California:

Fair Chance Ordinances

Adobe will consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records for employment in accordance with state and local laws and “fair chance” ordinances.

Colorado:

Application Window Notice

If this role is open to hiring in Colorado (as listed on the job posting), the application window will remain open until at least the date and time stated above in Pacific Time, in compliance with Colorado pay transparency regulations. If this role does not have Colorado listed as a hiring location, no specific application window applies, and the posting may close at any time based on hiring needs.

Massachusetts:

Massachusetts Legal Notice

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

Internal Opportunities

Creativity, curiosity, and constant learning are celebrated aspects of your career growth journey. We’re glad that you’re pursuing a new opportunity at Adobe!

Put your best foot forward:

1. Update your Resume/CV and Workday profile – don’t forget to include your uniquely ‘Adobe’ experiences and volunteer work.

2. Visit the Internal Mobility page on Inside Adobe to learn more about the process and set up a job alert for roles you’re interested in.

3. Check out these tips to help you prep for interviews.

4. If you are applying for a role outside of your current country, ensure you review the International Resources for Relocating Employees on Inside Adobe, including the impacts to your Benefits, AIP, Equity & Payroll.

Once you apply for a role via Workday, the Talent Team will reach out to you within 2 weeks. If you move into the official interview process with the hiring team, make sure you inform your manager so they can champion your career growth.

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more.

Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015.

title: Data Platform Architect
description:
Position Overview

America's Test Kitchen, a leading food media company, is seeking a highly skilled and strategic Data Platform Architect to shape and execute our data vision. This pivotal role will be responsible for both designing and implementing a robust data architecture and collaborating with Product Managers to support the strategic roadmap for data initiatives that empower our Research & Analytics, Marketing, and Digital Product teams to unlock actionable insights. You will work collaboratively within cross-functional agile teams, including Engineering, Product Design, and Quality Assurance, to solve critical business challenges through the strategic use of data.

Responsibilities
• Data Architecture & Strategy: Develop and champion the digital data architecture vision for our database models, ensuring security, scalability, feature enablement, and operational efficiency across all digital products. Define and implement comprehensive data strategies and data quality initiatives.
• Cross-functional Collaboration & Requirements Gathering: Partner with Research & Analytics, Marketing, and Digital Product teams to understand their data needs, translate them into actionable product requirements and user stories, and ensure alignment with overall business goals.
• Data Solution Design & Implementation: Translate business requirements into efficient and scalable database designs, data stores, and data streams. Maintain and improve large-scale data systems and workflows, proactively identifying areas for enhancement and refactoring.
• Performance & Reliability: Define and monitor key platform performance indicators (KPIs) related to data scale, performance, and reliability.
• Data Platform Strategy & Cross-Functional Alignment: Collaborate with Product Managers and stakeholders to define a clear strategic vision and help shape the prioritized roadmap for the evolution of our data platform and related initiatives. This includes ensuring the platform effectively supports the data needs of agile teams, stakeholders across Research & Analytics, Marketing, and Digital Product, and senior leadership. This role will involve close collaboration with Product Managers to align data platform capabilities with broader product strategies and customer needs.
• Strategic Data Utilization & Decision Enablement: Drive data-informed decision-making by leveraging both qualitative and quantitative data insights derived from business cases, market research, customer data, competitive analysis, and financial assessments. This role will be responsible for ensuring the data platform and related initiatives enable data-informed product decisions, partnering with the Product team to align strategic priorities and ensure technical feasibility.
• Technical Leadership & Innovation: Evaluate complex technical and product issues, providing in-depth analysis and demonstrating sound judgment in selecting solutions. Bring forward technology opportunities related to data that can unlock new functionality and performance for America's Test Kitchen.
• Risk Management & Communication: Proactively identify and escalate issues that may impact the delivery of data initiatives. Communicate complex technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
• Mentorship & Guidance: Provide technical mentorship and guidance to engineers and other team members on data-related best practices.

Skills You'll Need
• Data Architecture Expertise: Proven experience as a Data Architect with a strong understanding of database modeling, data warehousing, ETL processes, data governance, security, and privacy protocols (experience with sensitive customer and payment data is a plus).
• Product Partnerships & Strategic Alignment: Demonstrated ability to collaborate closely with Product Managers and cross-functional stakeholders to shape and prioritize data platform initiatives that support product and business goals. Experience contributing to a product vision and roadmap, documenting user stories and acceptance criteria within agile frameworks. Translating business needs into scalable data solutions and aligning architectural decisions with broader strategic priorities.
• Backend Technologies & Data Platforms: Expert-level understanding of backend technologies, with significant hands-on experience in designing and implementing data platforms, integrating data from various internal and external sources, and supporting BI and analytics tooling. Strong proficiency in both SQL and NoSQL databases, RESTful API development, and documentation is required. Experience with cloud-based data platforms and technologies is a plus.
• Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills: Strong proficiency in data analysis and the ability to translate data into actionable insights and product decisions. Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
• Communication & Collaboration Proficiency: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a proven ability to collaborate effectively across technical and non-technical teams and present complex information clearly.
• Strategic & Planning Capabilities: A proactive and strategic mindset with the ability to plan long-term roadmaps to support business needs and growth. Ability to perform financial and quantitative analyses to support product decisions.
• Modern Technology Stack Experience: Demonstrated experience developing across a modern web development stack, encompassing front-end technologies (React, TypeScript, JavaScript), back-end development (Ruby, Python), AWS cloud infrastructure, and Content Management Systems. Experience with third-party data integration methodologies and exposure to machine learning techniques are highly valued.
• Professional Qualities: Demonstrated resilience, empathy, adaptability, presence, innovation, humility, and the ability to navigate complexities.
• Education & Experience: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related field, or equivalent work experience. 8+ years of experience in software development, with at least 3+ years in database engineering. Experience with data related to digital subscriptions (e.g., subscriber behavior, churn analysis, content consumption) and/or media operations is a plus.

About America's Test Kitchen

The mission of America's Test Kitchen (ATK) is to empower and inspire confidence, community, and creativity in the kitchen. Founded in 1992, the company is the leading multimedia cooking resource serving millions of fans with TV shows (America's Test Kitchen, Cook's Country, and America's Test Kitchen: The Next Generation), magazines (Cook's Illustrated and Cook's Country), cookbooks, a podcast (Proof), FAST channels, short-form video series, and the ATK Essential Membership for digital content. Based in a state-of-the-art 15,000-square-foot test kitchen in Boston's Seaport District, ATK has earned the trust of home cooks and culinary experts alike thanks to its one-of-a-kind processes and best-in-class techniques. Fifty full-time (admittedly very meticulous) test cooks, editors, and product testers spend their days tweaking every variable to find the very best recipes, equipment, ingredients, and techniques. Learn more at https://www.americastestkitchen.com/.

Why America's Test Kitchen:

We're passionate about cooking, and about creating the best place to work. We're small enough for your ideas to make a big impact, and large enough to offer you opportunities to grow professionally at any stage of your career. We want you to take risks and make mistakes — that's how innovation happens in our test kitchen, in our offices, and in life.

We at America's Test Kitchen believe food media can be a powerful force for social change. We are passionate about building an inclusive workforce that represents many different cultures, backgrounds, abilities, identities, and perspectives.

We welcome your application.

title: Solution/Data Architect
description:
Our client is seeing a Solution Architect with data expertise to join the team. This architect will collaborate with business stakeholders to understand reference terms, processes, and requirements, then design and implement end-to-end data architecture layers. The individual will evaluate and recommend solutions for financial systems, including general ledger replacement, and define data governance standards to ensure compliance. The role involves creating holistic architecture proposals that encompass networking, security, and engineering requirements while maintaining a strong focus on the data pillar. Working alongside another data architect, this person must be able to look at the work the current architect has done, and be able to understand and interpret how it was built. The architect will support AI strategy initiatives, document architecture decisions, and serve as a subject matter expert for data modeling and solution architecture, ensuring clarity and scalability in all technical designs. The company is also going through a cloud migration from on prem to Azure, so this architect should have experience lifting and shifting data to the cloud.

$90/HR

We are a company committed to creating diverse and inclusive environments where people can bring their full, authentic selves to work every day. We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer that believes everyone matters. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment regardless of their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, national origin, ancestry, genetic factors, age, disability, protected veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or recruiting process, please send a request to HR@insightglobal.com.To learn more about how we collect, keep, and process your private information, please review Insight Global's Workforce Privacy Policy: https://insightglobal.com/workforce-privacy-policy/.

title: Senior Data Architect
description:
Company:
Marsh McLennan Agency

Description:

Our not-so-secret sauce.

Award-winning, inclusive, Top Workplace culture doesn't happen overnight. It's a result of hard work by extraordinary people. More than 11,000 of the industry's brightest talent drive our efforts to deliver purposeful work and meaningful impact every day. Learn more about what makes us different and how you can thrive as a Senior Data Architect at Marsh McLennan Agency (MMA).

MMA provides business insurance, employee health & benefits, retirement, and private client insurance solutions to organizations and individuals seeking limitless possibilities. With 200 offices across North America, we combine the personalized service model of a local consultant with the global resources of the world's leading professional services firm, Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC).

A day in the life.

As a Senior Data Architect on the Data team, you'll establish consistent data standards, reference architectures, patterns, and practices across the organization for both OLTP and OLAP (Data warehouse, Data Lake house) MDM and AI/ML technologies. You will define reference data architecture and work with agile teams to ensure the documented best practices are used in data platform development. Additionally, you'll create strategies and design solutions for a wide variety of use cases like Data Migration (end-to-end ETL process), database optimization, and data architectural solutions for Analytics Data Projects. You will also design, develop, and troubleshoot highly complex technical problems in OLAP/OLTP/DW, Analytics, and provide solutions for Enterprise-level Applications utilizing Azure Data Platform.

Our future colleague.

We'd love to meet you if your professional track record includes these skills:
• 10+ or more years of experience in Information Technology.
• 5 to 10 years of experience in Enterprise data architecture, Data, Modelling, Data management and Data strategy
• 5 to 7 years of experience in Cloud database technologies.
• 7 to 10 years of experience as a data architect
• Solid understanding of databases and the strengths and weaknesses of platforms and products, with the ability to provide a trusted voice at the decision-making table
• Expertise in creating ER (Entity Relationship), Logical, Physical, and Conceptual data models for an enterprise
• Experience in data modeling, streaming skills, and data architecture for operational and analytical datastores
• Proficiency in the design of batch and streaming data ingestion
• Knowledge in designing solutions with Data Quality, Data Lineage, and Data Catalogs
• Experience with solving performance challenges for a variety of velocities, latencies, and volumes of data
• Designing and maintaining the data models, including conceptual, logical, and physical data models
• Experience with SOA data layer utilizing data access frameworks and exposing data via web services
• Experience with Business Intelligence and data mart architecture
• Experience creating a data architecture vision between lines of business and IT
• Demonstrated competency in communicating the value of data architecture to stakeholders and senior management
• Experience in SDLC processes, database patterns, and development frameworks
• Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills, with the ability to develop and conduct executive-level presentations
• Experience crafting solutions that leverage data in NoSQL and SQL datastores for high availability and disaster tolerance
• Preferred experience with Kubernetes, Cloud Native ecosystem, and Data Lake/Data Warehouse technologies
• Deep expertise in Data engineering capabilities involving architecture, modeling (physical and logical), data governance, storage, security, resilience, and replication
• Knowledge of Informatica - IICS task flows development and maintenance
• Experience with MongoDB or another NoSQL database, PostgreSQL, or any relational database
• Experience with Azure, Data Lake, Databricks, SQL, ETL, and MDM
• Experience with data integration services such as Azure Data Factory
• Experience with business intelligence tools; Power BI or Qlik is preferred
• Experience in designing and building large-scale, enterprise systems in a highly available, scalable, performant, and distributed environment

These additional qualifications are a plus, but not required to apply:
• Knowledge of Agency Management systems like Applied EPIC and Vertafore Sagitta, Benefit Point
• Microsoft Azure Data Engineer or other cloud certifications
• Data bricks experience and certification

We know there are excellent candidates who might not check all of these boxes. Don't be shy. If you're close, we'd be very interested in meeting you.

Valuable benefits.

We value and respect the impact our colleagues make every day both inside and outside our organization. We've built a culture that promotes colleague well-being through robust benefit programs and resources, encourages professional and personal development, and celebrates opportunities to pursue the projects and causes that give colleagues fulfillment outside of work.

Some benefits included in this role are:
• Generous time off, including personal and volunteering
• Tuition reimbursement and professional development opportunities
• Remote work
• Charitable contribution match programs
• Stock purchase opportunities

To learn more about a career at MMA, check us out online: http://marshmma.com/careers or flip through our recruiting brochure: https://bit.ly/3Qpcjmw
Follow us on social media to meet our colleagues and see what makes us tick:
• https://www.instagram.com/lifeatmma/
• https://www.facebook.com/LifeatMMA
• https://www.linkedin.com/company/marsh-mclennan-agency/

Who you are is who we are.

We embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages, and perspectives of our colleagues and clients. We are always seeking those with ethics, talent, and ambition who are interested in joining our client-focused teams.

Marsh McLennan and its affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity employers.

#LI-Remote

The applicable base salary range for this role is $113,000 to $197,800.

The base pay offered will be determined on factors such as experience, skills, training, location, certifications, education, and any applicable minimum wage requirements. Decisions will be determined on a case-by-case basis. In addition to the base salary, this position may be eligible for performance-based incentives.

We are excited to offer a competitive total rewards package which includes health and welfare benefits, tuition assistance, 401K savings and other retirement programs as well as employee assistance programs.

Applications will be accepted until:

August 25, 2025

title: Associate Distinguished Engineer - Enterprise Data Architect
description:
Company Description

We are a Digital Product Engineering company that is scaling in a big way! We build products, services, and experiences that inspire, excite, and delight. We work at scale — across all devices and digital mediums, and our people exist everywhere in the world (15000+ experts across 26 countries, to be exact). Our work culture is dynamic and non-hierarchical. We are looking for great new colleagues. That is where you come in!

Job Description
• Strategic Data Leadership: Develop and implement a comprehensive data management and analytics strategy that aligns with the organization’s goals and delivers real-world impact
• Data Governance: Oversee data modeling, master data management, data governance policies and procedures to ensure data integrity, quality, and security, planning for data backup, disaster recovery, and business continuity.
• Data Lifecycle Management: Manage the full spectrum of data lifecycle activities, ensuring optimal data quality, storage, and utilization aligned with strategic goals.
• Data Architecture: Oversee design and refine the organizational data framework, ensuring robust, scalable, and efficient data structures and integrations in AWS
• Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure compliance with relevant data protection regulations and assess data-related risks.
• Technology and Vendor Management: Evaluate and implement data management and analytics tools and technologies to optimize data processing and analysis. Manage relationships, engagements, contracts, and agreements with external vendors that provide technology solutions.
• Collaboration: Work closely with various departments to understand their data needs and ensure that the data strategy supports these requirements, serving as the key liaison of the data function to the broader organization
• Change Management: Lead and facilitate the implementation of data-related changes, ensuring smooth transitions and alignment with organizational goals.

Qualifications
• A minimum of 10 years of experience in data management and analytics, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
• Relevant experience in creating and executing enterprise data strategy in AWS
• Transforming business goals into data infrastructure
• Experience in Data governance, Data modeling, Data security, Data strategy, MDM – AWS, Denodo
• Experience in Industrial IoT and relevant Data Science use cases.
• Knowledge in Manufacturing domain and good to have lighting or similar domain or IOT related use case knowledge.

Additional Information

Disclaimer: Nagarro is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination based on race, creed, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, or marital status.

title: [Remote] Adobe Experience Platform Data Architect, Contract
description:
Note: The job is a remote job and is open to candidates in USA. DEPT® is a pioneering technology and marketing services company that creates integrated end-to-end digital experiences for brands. The role involves working closely with enterprise clients to design customer-centric data models and oversee data ingestion for the Adobe Experience Platform.

Responsibilities
• Coordinate closely with the Adobe project team and work directly with customers to document requirements for the Adobe platform solution.
• Collaborate with Enterprise Architect and Digital Strategist roles to provide data discovery through systems and business process review.
• Analyze a customer's disparate data sources (e.g., sales, CRM, analytics data) to design and tailor a data model that unifies the data to meet their digital marketing use cases.
• Configure the Adobe platform data lake and real-time customer profile for data ingestion and activation. Create REST APIs, use POSTMAN, and write ad hoc basic scripting to automate setup across environments.
• Test your schema design by loading sample data within the platform and coordinating with Data Engineer consultants for final customer data importing.
• Build, test, and schedule customer segments to activate marketing use cases.
• Develop tailored, sophisticated SQL to provide answers to customers' business questions using the combined platform data (e.g., a 360-degree view of the customer).
• As part of a consulting organization, you'll be responsible for project time tracking, billing hours, and forecasting time toward customer projects and other key reporting.
• Join a team of Data Architects to learn and innovate together on new insights to improve team processes and solve customer needs.

Skills
• Proficiency and experience with designing customer-centric database models and datasets (e.g., CRM, Call Center, Marketing, Offline, Point of Sale, etc.).
• Proficiency with data transformation & ETL tools (e.g., Informatica, Unifi, Snaplogic) on large data sets.
• Proficiency with Data Modeling experience (e.g., Relational, Dimensional, Columnar, Big Data).
• Proficiency with complex SQL and NoSQL experience.
• Experience in advanced Data Warehouse concepts.
• Experience with Business Requirements definition and management, structured analysis, process design, and use case documentation.
• Experience with Reporting Technologies (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI).
• Experience in professional software development.
• Exceptional organizational skills and ability to multi-task simultaneous different customer projects.
• Strong verbal and written communication skills to coordinate with the Sales team and lead customers to a successful outcome.
• Must be self-managed, proactive, and customer-centric.
• A Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science or a related field.

Company Overview
• DEPT® is a Growth Invention company built to help the world’s most ambitious brands grow faster. It was founded in 2016, and is headquartered in Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, NLD, with a workforce of 1001-5000 employees. Its website is https://www.deptagency.com.

title: Senior Analytics Engineer I
description:
Company Description

Are you ready to trade your job for a journey? Become a FlyMate!

Passion, excitement & global collaboration are all core to what it means to be a FlyMate. At Flywire, we’re on a mission to deliver the world’s most important and complex payments. We use our Flywire Advantage - the combination of our next-gen payments platform, proprietary payment network and vertical specific software, to help our clients get paid, and help their customers pay with ease - no matter where they are in the world.

What more do we need to truly be unstoppable? Perhaps, that is you!

Who we are:

Flywire is a global payments enablement and software company, founded a decade ago to solve high-stakes, high-value payments in education, using modern technology.

Today, we’ve digitized payments for more than 3,000 global clients across education, healthcare, travel & B2B, covering more than 240 countries and territories and supporting over 140 currencies. And, we’re just getting started!

With over 950+ global FlyMates, representing more than 40 nationalities, and in 14 offices world-wide, we’re looking for FlyMates to join the next stage of our journey as we continue to grow.

Job Description
• Design, build, and optimize robust, reusable, and scalable data pipelines and transformations (using dbt, SQL, and cloud data warehouse technologies).
• Collaborate with data engineers to ensure reliable data ingestion and with analysts to enable self-service analytics.
• Develop and maintain well-documented data models, definitions, and metadata to ensure data consistency and transparency.
• Partner with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into high-quality analytical datasets.
• Implement and maintain data quality checks, testing frameworks, and monitoring processes.
• Support performance optimization across ETL/ELT processes and query execution.
• Drive best practices in data governance, version control, and documentation within the analytics engineering team.
• Mentor junior team members and contribute to continuous improvement of data workflows and standards.

Qualifications

Must-Have:
• 7+ years of experience in data engineering, analytics engineering, or related roles.
• Advanced proficiency in SQL and strong experience with data transformation tools (e.g., dbt).
• Hands-on experience with cloud data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Databricks). Big Query preferred.
• Solid understanding of data modeling principles (e.g., Kimball, Data Vault, or modern ELT architectures).
• Strong Python skills for data manipulation and automation.
• Experience implementing CI/CD practices in data environments (e.g., Git-based workflows, testing frameworks).
• Excellent communication skills and ability to work cross-functionally with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Nice-to-Have:
• Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI, Mode).
• Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Dagster, Prefect).
• Understanding of data privacy, compliance, and security principles.
• Experience in an Agile delivery environment.

Additional Information

Submit today and get started!

We are excited to get to know you! Throughout our process you can expect to meet with different FlyMates including the Hiring Manager, Peers on the team, the VP of the department, and a skills assessment. Your Talent Acquisition Partner will walk you through the steps and be your “go-to” person for any questions.

Flywire is an equal opportunity employer. With over 40 nationalities across 12 different offices, and diversity and inclusion at the core of our people agenda, we believe our FlyMates are our greatest asset, and we’re excited to watch our unique culture evolve with each new hire.

#LI-Hybrid

title: Sr. Data Engineer/Tech Lead
description:
At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will :
• demonstrate expert skills in ETL/ELT, data integration, ML Ops, and SQL, as well as intermediate to advanced skills in Python, Pyspark, AI/ML, and data visualization.
• demonstrate the ability to review, optimize, document, and mentor data/visualization engineers on data pipelines, mapping, cleansing, and visual design using various tools and platforms.
• possess ability to break down moderately complex problems to implement for increased business impact
• support other team members and helps them to be successful. Actively shares learnings with team members
• drive and enforce the team process improvements, ensuring others are brought along in understanding the benefits and tradeoffs
• actively promote new and innovative ideas across multiple teams and capabilities

Key Responsibilities

Hands-On Development (75%)
• Build, and maintain scalable data platforms and infrastructure on AWS
• Implement end-to-end data pipelines for batch and real-time data processing
• Build robust ETL/ELT workflows to ingest, transform, and load data from diverse sources
• Implement data lake/Lakehouse architectures using AWS S3, Glue, Athena, and Lake Formation
• Design and optimize data warehouse solutions (Redshift, Snowflake) for analytics and reporting
• Establish data quality frameworks and automated monitoring systems
• Write production-quality Python code for data processing, transformation, and automation
• Build scalable data pipelines using Apache Airflow, AWS Step Functions, or similar orchestration tool
• Develop streaming data solutions using Kinesis, Kafka, or AWS MSK
• Optimize SQL queries and database performance for large-scale datasets
• Implement data validation, cleansing, and quality checks
• Build APIs and microservices for data access and integration
• Create monitoring, alerting, and observability solutions for data pipelines
• Debug and resolve data pipeline failures and performance bottlenecks

Technical Leadership & Collaboration (25%)
• Mentor junior and mid-level data engineers through code reviews and technical guidance
• Establish best practices for data engineering, testing, and deployment
• Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements
• Work with ML engineers to build data pipelines supporting machine learning workflows
• Partner with platform/infrastructure teams on cloud architecture and cost optimization
• Lead technical design discussions and architectural reviews
• Document data architectures, pipelines, and processes
• Evangelize data engineering best practices across the organization

Required Qualifications

Technical Expertise
• 10+ years of professional experience in data engineering or related roles
• Expert-level proficiency in Python for data engineering:
• Data processing libraries: Pandas, PySpark, Dask, Polars
• API development: FastAPI, Flask
• Testing: Pytest, unittest
• Strong AWS expertise with hands-on experience in:
• Data Storage: S3, RDS/Aurora, DynamoDB, Redshift
• Data Processing: Glue (ETL jobs, crawlers, Data Catalog), EMR, Athena
• Streaming: Kinesis (Data Streams, Firehose, Analytics), MSK (Managed Kafka)
• Orchestration: Step Functions, EventBridge, Lambda
• Analytics: QuickSight, Athena, Redshift Spectrum
• Data Lake: Lake Formation, Glue Data Catalog
• Infrastructure: CloudFormation, CDK, IAM, VPC, CloudWatch
• Workflow Orchestration:
• Apache Airflow (strong preference)
• Big Data Technologies:
• Apache Spark (PySpark) for distributed data processing
• Experience with EMR, Databricks, or similar platforms
• Understanding of distributed computing concepts
• Parquet, Avro, ORC file formats

Architecture & Design
• Solid understanding and implementation knowledge of data modelling (dimensional modelling, star/snowflake schemas)
• Experience with both batch and streaming data processing patterns
• Knowledge of data lake, data warehouse, and lake-house architectures
• Understanding of data partitioning, bucketing, and optimization strategies
• Expertise in designing for data quality, lineage, and governance

DevOps & Best Practices
• Strong experience with CI/CD pipelines for data engineering (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins)
• Infrastructure as Code using Terraform, CloudFormation, or AWS CDK
• Containerization with Docker; experience with ECS/Fargate/Kubernetes is a plus
• Git version control and branching strategies
• Monitoring and observability tools: CloudWatch, Grafana
• Data pipeline testing strategies and frameworks

Preferred Qualifications
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related field (or equivalent experience)
• Experience in regulated industries (healthcare/pharma, finance, government) with compliance requirements
• Hands-on experience with:
• Additional AWS services: Glue DataBrew, AppFlow, Data Pipeline, Lambda, SageMaker
• Streaming platforms: Apache Kafka, Confluent, AWS MSK
• Data quality tools: Great Expectations, dbt, Monte Carlo, Bigeye
• Data cataloging: AWS Glue Data Catalog, Alation, Collibra
• Alternative clouds: GCP (BigQuery, Dataflow), Azure (Synapse, Data Factory)
• Data orchestration: dbt for transformation workflows
• Experience with clinical data, life sciences, or statistical computing domains (CDISC standards, clinical trials data)
• Knowledge of data mesh or data fabric architectures
• Experience building data platforms for ML/AI workloads
• Familiarity with data governance and metadata management frameworks

Lilly is dedicated to helping individuals with disabilities to actively engage in the workforce, ensuring equal opportunities when vying for positions. If you require accommodation to submit a resume for a position at Lilly, please complete the accommodation request form (https://careers.lilly.com/us/en/workplace-accommodation) for further assistance. Please note this is for individuals to request an accommodation as part of the application process and any other correspondence will not receive a response.

Lilly does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

#WeAreLilly

title: Senior Data Engineer with Data Bricks_ Exp: 5+ Years
description:
Job Description:

Role & responsibilities
• Implement efficient and maintainable code using best process and coding standards.
• Design, develop, test, and deploy high-performance and scalable data solutions using Python.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
• Implement efficient and maintainable code using best practices and coding standards
• Utilize experiences in SQL to design, optimize, and maintain relational databases.
• Write complex SQL queries for data retrieval, manipulation, and analysis.
• Perform database performance tuning and optimization. Databricks Platform
• Work with Databricks platform for big data processing and analytics.
• Develop and maintain ETL processes using Databricks notebooks.
• Implement and optimize data pipelines for data transformation and integration.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
Job Title: Analytics Engineer

Language: Excellent English proficiency (both written and verbal)

Work Mode: Remote

Working Hours: As per international clients requirements

Salary: Up to ?12 LPA (depending on experience and skill set)

Experience: 3-6 years

Job Summary

We are seeking a detail-oriented Analytics Engineer with 3-6 years of experience in building and optimizing data models, transforming raw data into actionable insights, and maintaining scalable analytics workflows. The role involves working closely with data engineers and analysts to develop efficient ELT pipelines, maintain data models using dbt , and ensure the reliability and accuracy of analytics in Snowflake or similar cloud data warehouses.

The ideal candidate combines strong SQL and data modeling expertise with a deep understanding of analytics workflows, data transformation, and business intelligence. You will also work with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker to translate structured data into actionable insights for business stakeholders.

What We Do

Opvia.in provides an end-to-end offshore hiring platform for international clients. We streamline talent recruitment, onboarding, compliance, virtual infrastructure, and team management. By leveraging technology-driven solutions, we ensure operational efficiency, transparency, and scalable offshore teams for global businesses.

What You'll Do

Data Modeling & Transformation:

Build, maintain, and optimize data models in dbt and Snowflake. Ensure data accuracy, scalability, and reusability through best practices in modular SQL and documentation.

ELT Pipeline Development:

Design and implement ELT workflows that extract, load, and transform data from various sources into analytics-ready tables and views.

Data Quality & Governance:

Establish validation tests and data monitoring within dbt to ensure data consistency, lineage, and reliability across environments.

Collaboration with Data & Business Teams:

Work closely with data engineers and analysts to define business metrics, model raw data into meaningful structures, and optimize queries for performance.

BI Tools & Analytics Applications:

Support teams in creating dashboards and reports using BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker. Translate structured data into actionable insights that help business stakeholders make informed decisions.

Documentation & Reporting:

Maintain detailed documentation of transformations, models, and dependencies. Support teams with accessible and well-structured data for dashboards and analytics.

Required Skills & Experience
• Data Modeling & Transformation: 3-6 years of experience in analytics engineering or related roles.
• SQL & dbt: Strong proficiency in writing complex SQL queries and using dbt for transformation, testing, and documentation.
• Data Warehousing: Hands-on experience with Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift.
• ELT Pipelines: Experience in designing and maintaining automated ELT workflows.
• Version Control: Familiarity with Git for collaborative development and model management.
• Data Visualization Exposure: Basic understanding of BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) to support analytics workflows.

Soft Skills
• Excellent verbal and written communication in English for collaboration with remote teams and international clients.
• Strong analytical thinking, attention to detail, and problem-solving abilities.
• Ability to work independently and deliver high-quality work in a fast-paced environment.
• Proactive and collaborative mindset with strong ownership of deliverables.

Preferred Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Engineering, or a related field.
• Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure.
• Exposure to CI/CD pipelines, Airflow, or other orchestration tools.
• Familiarity with modern data stack tools (Fivetran, Stitch, Snowpipe, etc.).
• Experience working with offshore or international clients.

Why Work With Us
• Hands-On Experience: Work with modern data stack tools and cloud analytics platforms.
• Technology-Driven Environment: Build scalable and automated analytics systems.
• Professional Growth: Collaborate with global clients and cross-functional data teams.
• Impactful Work: Enable data-driven decision-making and strategic insights.
• Startup Culture: Flexible, collaborative, and growth-oriented workplace.

title: Marketing Analytics Engineer
description:
Why Lytx

We are seeking a highly skilled Marketing Analytics Engineer to own and optimize the full analytics pipeline from data ingestion and modeling in Redshift to the development of actionable Tableau dashboards that empower marketing stakeholders with insights. As a key member of the Marketing Operations and Analytics team, this person will collaborate closely with marketing operations, sales operations, data engineering, and analytics partners, to ensure data quality and consistency, and to transform complex data into intuitive visualizations that inform strategic decisions, drive pipeline growth, and measure performance across marketing programs.

You’ll Get To

Analytics Pipeline Ownership
• Work closely with data engineering to build and maintain robust data pipelines in AWS and Redshift to source and process data for marketing analytics use cases
• Develop and optimize data models and staging layers tailored to lifecycle and campaign performance KPIs
• Dashboard and Reporting Development o Create, maintain, and improve Tableau dashboards that deliver clear, compelling, and self-serviceable insights for marketing stakeholders
• Translate business requirements into thoughtful, scalable visualizations for marketing stakeholders.
• Analyze and report on marketing effectiveness, pipeline contribution, and funnel progression across a range of channels including email, paid advertising, events and ABM. o Unlock new growth by building and/or updating existing predictive, attribution, and forecasting models to advise marketing decision making.
• Find opportunities for improvement in reporting; modify existing tools, techniques, or processes to improve our data-driven partnerships.

Cross-Functional Collaboration
• Work closely with data engineering to align on source data ingestion, table structures, and governance
• Partner with marketing and sales operations to translate reporting requirements into scalable data models and Tableau visualizations
• Partner with internal analytics and operations teams to standardize and document data models, dashboard logic, and metric definitions to ensure accurate reporting across systems

What You’ll Need
• 5+ years of experience in data analytics, with at least 3 years supporting marketing in a B2B SaaS business
• Proficient in SQL, Python and data warehousing concepts, with hands-on experience building data models and pipelines in Redshift (or similar cloud data warehouse)
• Strong Tableau skills, with a portfolio of dashboards used by marketing and executive stakeholders
• Deep understanding of B2B marketing funnels, campaign performance, and digital channels
• Experience working with large datasets, marketing automation tools (e.g., Marketo), and CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce) is a plus
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to distill complex data into simple business narratives
• Must be able to work 7:30 to 11:30 PM to effectively collaborate with teams in Pacific Time Zone

Innovation Lives Here

You go all in no matter what you do, and so do we. At Lytx, we’re powered by cutting-edge technology and Happy People. You want your work to make a positive impact in the world, and that’s what we do. Join our diverse team of hungry, humble and capable people united to make a difference.

Together, we help save lives on our roadways.

Find out how good it feels to be a part of an inclusive, collaborative team. We’re committed to delivering an environment where everyone feels valued, included and supported to do their best work and share their voices.

Lytx, Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and maintains a drug-free workplace. We’re committed to attracting, retaining and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. EOE/M/F/Disabled/Vet.

title: Data Analyst / Analytics Engineer
description:
Data Analyst / Analytics Engineer - Client Analytics and Strategy Team, AVP
Job Description:

Job Title: Data Analyst / Analytics Engineer - Client Analytics and Strategy Team, AVP

Location: Mumbai, India

Role Description

The Sales Analytics specialist develops and manages the end-to-end process of delivering the sales analytics and decks and insights to stakeholders, bringing transparency to the Corporate Bank Leadership teams as well as the Coverage and Sales organisations on our top client relationships. The role requires a holistic understanding of internal and external client data, along with the ability to distill and communicate a contextualized narrative with actionable insights to a wide audience. As part of the Account Plan squad and in collaboration with Coverage, the role will support the build out, training and provide ongoing support to colleagues across the Corporate Bank.

What we’ll offer you

As part of our flexible scheme, here are just some of the benefits that you’ll enjoy
• Best in class leave policy
• Gender neutral parental leaves
• 100% reimbursement under childcare assistance benefit (gender neutral)
• Sponsorship for Industry relevant certifications and education
• Employee Assistance Program for you and your family members
• Comprehensive Hospitalization Insurance for you and your dependents
• Accident and Term life Insurance
• Complementary Health screening for 35 yrs. and above

Your key responsibilities
• Production, enhancement, maintenance of Global MI related to the Corporate Bank,
• Data quality controls, enabling translation / transformation of data to stitch together disparate data sources and drive data clean-up
• Consolidate different datasets to fabricate essential client insights
• Drive effort of integrating analytics into strategic platforms and other relevant forums
• Support the business by building and deploying value-added MI and Dashboards
• Support audit and regulatory requests by provided data after validation and aggregation
• Support Management teams with investigations, deep dives and adhoc analysis

Your skills and experience
• Experience in Analytical tools such as Tableau and SQL
• 8+ years of experience in data visualization (preferably Tableau)
• Design and build Tableau dashboards
• Be hands-on and very familiar with complex SQL
• Understand data modelling and data warehouse designs
• Data modeling: from raw data, to building report and eventually deployment of dashboards
• Be able to do required changes on database level (design and build new tables, views etc.)
• Strong MI background with high data interpretation skills
• Work with users to understand business requirements and design solutions
• Strong interpersonal skills, communication, stakeholder management & teamwork
• Ability to work independently and under tight deadlines
• Relevant experience in the banking sector

How we’ll support you
• Training and development to help you excel in your career
• Coaching and support from experts in your team
• A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
• A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs

About us and our teams

Please visit our company website for further information:

https://www.db.com/company/company.htm

We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.

Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.

We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.
Experience Level
Executive Level

title: Technical Data Engineer - GTM Services Marketing
description:
We help the world run better
At SAP, we keep it simple: you bring your best to us, and we'll bring out the best in you. We're builders touching over 20 industries and 80% of global commerce, and we need your unique talents to help shape what's next. The work is challenging – but it matters. You'll find a place where you can be yourself, prioritize your wellbeing, and truly belong. What's in it for you? Constant learning, skill growth, great benefits, and a team that wants you to grow and succeed.

WHAT YOU’LL BUILD:

For our Go-To-Market Services for Marketing team as part of the Customer & Partner unit within the global Corporate Processes & Information Technology (CPIT) Organization we are looking for a Technical Data Engineer with the mindset for highest level of service for our internal customers and support to take SAP’s Marketing Technology Stack to the next level as part of our transformation journey to achieve SAP’s goals.

In your role as Technical Data Engineer, you will be responsible for:

WHAT YOU BRING:

WHERE YOU BELONG:

Our team is responsible for the design, implementation and operations of IT solutions, supporting SAP’s core business processes mainly in Marketing and closely interacting with respective LoBs. Here, we act as the Businesses trusted advisor and expert, driving together the simplification, harmonization, and intelligence of business processes. We enable solutions for the Demand-to-Lead process area with the adoption of state-of-the-art solutions embracing innovation as well as new technologies to achieve higher effectiveness.

Besides our day-to-day business we are passionate about technology and always looking for new options to improve the way we work and deliver value to business.

Bring out your best
SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.

We win with inclusion
SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better world.

SAP is committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provides accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability, in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local legal requirements.

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

AI Usage in the Recruitment Process

For information on the responsible use of AI in our recruitment process, please refer to our Guidelines for Ethical Usage of AI in the Recruiting Process.

Please note that any violation of these guidelines may result in disqualification from the hiring process.
