title: Excel VBA and Power BI Developer
description:
Back

At BCE Global Tech we are on a mission to modernize global connectivity, one connection at a time. We aim to build the highway to the future of communications, media and entertainment, determined to emerge as a powerhouse within the technology landscape in India team in Bengaluru.

We bring ambitions to life through design thinking that bridges the gaps between people, devices and beyond, fostering unprecedented customer satisfaction through technology.

Our core values support a customer-centric approach and the harnessing of cutting-edge technology to provide business outcomes with positive societal impact. Guided by innovation and a commitment to progress, we’re shaping a brighter future for the generations of today and tomorrow.

If you would like to be a part of a team of thought-leaders pioneering advancements in 5G, MEC, IoT and cloud-native architecture, we’d love to hear from you.

We are looking for an Intermediate Software Developer to join our dynamic team and contribute to the development of high-performance applications.

Job Description

As an Intermediate Excel VBA and Power BI Developer, you will play a key role in automating operational processes and delivering insightful dashboards that support BCE’s business units. You will work closely with stakeholders across finance, operations, and technology to streamline reporting, enhance data visibility, and support strategic initiatives.

Key Responsibilities
• Develop and maintain robust Excel VBA macros to automate manual workflows and reporting processes.
• Design and deploy Power BI dashboards that provide real-time insights into operational and financial performance.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate them into scalable technical solutions.
• Integrate data from various sources (Excel, SQL Server, SharePoint, APIs) into Power BI for unified reporting.
• Optimize existing Excel tools and Power BI reports for performance, usability, and maintainability.
• Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with BCE’s data governance standards.
• Document solutions and provide training/support to end users as needed.

Required Skills & Qualifications
• 3–5 years of hands-on experience in Excel VBA development.
• Strong expertise in Power BI, including DAX, Power Query (M), and data modeling.
• Proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases.
• Experience integrating Excel and Power BI with enterprise data sources.
• Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, agile environment.

Nice To Have
• Experience with Power Automate or other Microsoft Power Platform tools.
• Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
• Exposure to telecom or enterprise operations is a plus.

What We Offer
• Competitive salaries and comprehensive health benefits
• Flexible work hours and remote work options
• Professional development and training opportunities
• A supportive and inclusive work environment
• Access to cutting-edge technology and tools.

title: Senior Data Analyst (SQL, Power BI)
description:
BI & Data Analyst Location: Experience Level: 7 Years +
About the Job: We’re transforming how we work by harnessing the power of AI, data, and digital innovation to accelerate the discovery and development of life-saving therapies. Our vision is to embed artificial intelligence and advanced analytics across every stage of our scientific and operational workflows—empowering our teams with smarter tools, seamless data, and actionable insights to deliver client-centric services and solutions that better serve our customers and, ultimately, improve patients’ lives.

BI & Data Analyst you will be focused on:
Analyzing complex scientific datasets to uncover meaningful insights and support strategic initiatives.
Mapping key business process rules to ensure data solutions align with operational realities.
Creating insight-driven solutions that bring visibility into critical KPIs and performance metrics.
Conducting deep-dive analyses to solve challenging problems and support evidence-based recommendations.

We work closely with cross-functional engineering and business partners to deliver impactful data and analytics solutions that shape the future of research and development.

Engage Business Stakeholders at all levels to identify requirements for current and future products through ongoing interaction.
Analyze business processes and develop business flow diagrams and data flow diagrams to support system design and optimization.
Data Profiling, mining, and data validation/testing to ensure data is fit for use by the business.
Analyze complex datasets using SQL Server to identify patterns, detect anomalies, and uncover embedded business rules.
Lead requirements workshops and User Acceptance Testing for new data, products and analytics solutions.
Work cross-functionally with engineering, product, and business teams to ensure alignment and successful delivery.
Perform ad-hoc analysis and present results in a clear and user-friendly manner.
Build strong business relationships that foster a collaborative and trusting approach and partnership.
Act as scrum master for the team and prepare detailed stories for developers.

Bachelor degree in Business Management, Computer Science or any related field.
Master in Business Administration/ Information Systems/ Computer Science is an asset.
Ability to translate requirements to well-written user stories to bridge the gap between business and technology.
Strong business mindset with ability to collaborate with business partners to identify needs and opportunities for improved data management and delivery.
Ability to see big picture and then identify key areas for deep analysis to support sound solutions.
Experience in life science or Biotechnology industry is a plus.

Minimum of 5 years’ experience in writing complex SQL queries, data mining, data profiling, and data validation/testing;
Minimum of 5 years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst / Data Analyst specializing in the Data & Analytics discipline, preferably in a senior or lead role;
Minimum of 5 years’ experience organizing and running User Acceptance Testing cycles and training with business users and stakeholders;
Experience working with Data Visualization Tools like Power BI, Tableau, Looker, MicroStrategy
Experienced working in Agile Software Development Methodology.

title: Senior Data & Digital Analyst
description:
Role: Senior Analyst - Digital Data Analytics & BI
Years of Experience: 4 to 6 years
Job Location: Bangalore (Indiranagar)
Work Type: Hybrid
Shift Timing : 1 :00 PM to 10:00 PM

Overview

Assembly is a global marketing services company designed with the modern mixture of omnichannel media expertise, powered by data, technology and business consulting solutions that help the best brands on the planet find the change that fuels growth. As a Senior Business Intelligence Associate at Assembly Global, you will support the design, development and deployment of custom reporting and data visualization solutions that drive marketing intelligence insights for leading brands. You will support a data-driven consultancy team leveraging data science, automation and visualizations to identify metrics-based strategies for driving media efficiencies and effectiveness. The role requires detail-oriented capture of requirements for reporting solutions and skills with SQL, ETL and data visualization platforms such as Tableau.

What you'll do:
• With the guidance of senior analytics personnel, you will support the customization and production of reporting solutions for clients using a combination of tools such as AWS cloud computing, Tableau and online collaboration tools such as Sharepoint.
• Work closely with internal teams and clients to gather requirements for internal and external stakeholder measurement needs related to the visualization of an array of defined market research and industry intelligence data points.
• Work closely with senior BI team members for the development of automated data visualizations (e.g. Tableau, Datorama, GDS) to empower stakeholders with insights and performance metrics on-demand.
• Generate reports, documentation and insights as part of the analysis process.
• Support quality control procedures for analysis, reporting and data visualization for accuracy.

Other duties as assigned Skills & knowledge you should possess:
• 4+ years of with digital marketing analytics in a client-side or agency-side environment with experience leveraging analytic platforms to measure and deliver performance reporting insights.
• Experience with Tableau and Cloud Computing with aptitude and desire to develop expertise
• Strong SQL capability and above with aptitude and desire to develop expertise
• Confidence to communicate clearly on the inputs and outputs of data visualizations and field emergent questions in consultative manner using relatable terminology over jargon.
• Ability to balance multiple priorities and meet project deadlines
• Excellent oral and written communication skills

EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES

Assembly is an advocate for equal opportunity in the workplace. We are committed to ensuring equal opportunities regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability and gender identity. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

SOCIAL & ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSIBILITY

At Assembly, we have a responsibility to bring impact into our every day. This means we must always look for ways in which to be conscious citizens in our roles to support society and environmental sustainability. We encourage employees to; be a conscious citizen by actively participating in our organisation's sustainability efforts, help us promote environmentally friendly practices within the workplace, collaborate with community organisations and stakeholders to support initiatives aligned with our company's values, participate in volunteer activities that benefit the community. Employees are also encouraged to make suggestions and evaluate our business practices to identify areas for improvement in social and environmental performance. Employees at Assembly demonstrate commitment to sustainability and inclusivity in their actions and behaviours.

title: Data Analyst – SparkNova Tech Solutions (Bengaluru, India)
description:
Job Type: Full-Time | Experience: 0–2 Years | Location: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India
Industry: Analytics, Technology, Business Intelligence
Keywords: Data Analyst Jobs Bengaluru, Entry-Level Data Analyst, SQL Analyst, BI Analyst, Power BI Jobs, Tableau Jobs, Data Visualisation, Analytics Careers India

About SparkNova Tech Solutions

SparkNova Tech Solutions is a rapidly growing analytics-driven company committed to transforming raw data into actionable business insights. We work with modern technologies, data platforms, and analytical tools to help organisations make smarter, data-backed decisions. As we expand our analytics team, we’re looking for enthusiastic talent eager to explore data, solve complex problems, and grow with us in a dynamic and collaborative environment.

If you are someone who loves working with numbers, uncovering trends, and presenting insights through impactful data visualisations, this is the perfect opportunity to kick-start or advance your analytics career.

Job Overview

We are hiring a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our analytics team in Bengaluru. The ideal candidate will analyse large datasets, create insightful dashboards, and support strategic decision-making across departments. This role is perfect for fresh graduates or early-career professionals who want hands-on exposure to real-world analytics and business intelligence projects.

You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including operations, product, sales, and leadership teams, ensuring that data-driven insights are integrated into daily business strategies. If you’re looking for a role where learning, innovation, and professional development are prioritised, SparkNova Tech Solutions is the right place to grow.

Key Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst at SparkNova Tech Solutions, you will:
• Collect, clean, analyse, and validate large datasets from various internal and external sources.
• Build interactive dashboards, automated reports, and visualisations using Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio.
• Identify patterns, correlations, and trends that help solve business challenges and improve performance outcomes.
• Partner with cross-functional teams to understand their analytics needs and deliver actionable recommendations.
• Prepare clear, engaging presentations for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and security across reporting processes and analytics workflows.
• Assist senior analysts in building predictive models and forecasting tools for business planning.
• Support ongoing data improvements by documenting processes, optimising datasets, and standardising reporting.

Required Skills & Qualifications

To succeed in this role, you should have:
• A Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related analytics discipline.
• 0–2 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar roles.
• Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, SQL, and at least one data visualisation tool (Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio).
• Basic exposure to Python or R for data manipulation or analysis.
• Excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and an eye for detail.
• Strong communication skills with the ability to break down complex data insights for non-technical audiences.
• A willingness to learn, adapt, and grow in a fast-paced, technology-driven environment.

What We Offer

At SparkNova Tech Solutions, we believe in empowering our employees with opportunities to learn, grow, and succeed. Here’s what you can expect:
• Competitive salary package and performance-based growth bonuses.
• Hands-on experience with real-world analytics projects and live data environments.
• Continuous mentorship from experienced data analysts, engineers, and business leaders.
• A collaborative, learning-oriented culture where new ideas and analytical thinking are appreciated.
• Access to modern tools, cloud technologies, and data platforms.
• An office located in one of Bengaluru’s most vibrant tech hubs, with a dynamic work atmosphere, cafes, and innovation-driven surroundings.

Why Join SparkNova Tech Solutions?

If you’re passionate about turning data into decisions and want to build a meaningful career in analytics, SparkNova gives you the right platform. You’ll not only enhance your technical skills but also gain deep business understanding, cross-team collaboration experience, and the confidence to solve real-world problems.

This role is ideal for candidates who want to grow quickly, contribute to impactful projects, and be part of a company that values innovation, curiosity, and data-driven thinking.

How to Apply

Interested candidates can submit their updated resume, portfolio/GitHub (if available), and a short note about their interest in data analytics.

title: Strategic Business Analyst
description:
Job Title:

Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:

We are seeking a skilled Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Data and Integration team within IT services. Our team collaborates across the organization to ensure access to the enterprise data platform and deliver innovative solutions that drive business growth.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in stakeholder management, with experience in building and maintaining relationships across diverse networks. They will be proficient in gathering and documenting business requirements for data platform, business intelligence, integration, and automation requests.

The Business Intelligence Analyst will work closely with the Engagement Director in a dynamic environment with changing priorities. Their main responsibility will be to understand the business vision and translate it into clear requirements for delivery teams. They will also manage stakeholder and customer relationships, ensuring their needs and expectations are met.

The role involves supporting stakeholder engagements by facilitating effective communication and collaboration, documenting business processes, effective communication, team collaboration, data analysis, integration support, and continuous improvement.
• Key Responsibilities:
• Support Stakeholder Engagements: Facilitate effective communication and collaboration with stakeholders, ensuring an exceptional customer experience and adherence to best practices.
• Document Business Processes: Understand and document business processes within a global enterprise application environment.
• Effective Communication: Communicate and interact with colleagues coherently, aligning with the organisation's values.
• Team Collaboration: Collaborate effectively across teams, ensuring clear and concise communication.
• Data Analysis: Perform data analysis to identify trends and insights that can inform business decisions and drive priorities.
• Integration Support: Assist in the integration of various enterprise applications, ensuring seamless data flow and system interoperability.
• Continuous Improvement: Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives by identifying areas for process optimisation and efficiency.

Requirements:

To be successful in this role, you will need to possess the following skills and qualifications:
• Proficient Skills:
• Stakeholder Management: Proficient in stakeholder management with a strong emphasis on exceeding customer expectations. Familiar with customer relationship management systems.
• Relationship Building: Capable of building and maintaining relationships across a diverse network of stakeholders.
• Interpersonal Skills: Exhibits a highly motivated and proactive approach to completing tasks. Possesses strong interpersonal, verbal, written, and presentation skills.
• Gathering Requirements: Familiar with gathering and documenting business requirements from stakeholders for data platform, business intelligence, integration, and automation requests.
• Background in Business Analysis: Background in business analysis with a focus on delivering business intelligence solutions.
• Database Servers: Experienced in working with database servers like Oracle and SQL Server.

• Azure Experience: Basic knowledge of Microsoft Azure data and AI artifacts, such as Azure Synapse, Azure SQL Server, Azure Analysis Services, Power BI, and Azure Data Lake, is a plus.
• Education and Experience: Holds a bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, finance, or equivalent education and experience. Equivalent experience may be considered in place of a degree.

title: Sr. Tableau developer
description:
Sr. Tableau developer

Role Overview

We are seeking a skilled Tableau Developer with a strong background in SQL and data modeling to design, develop, and maintain scalable business intelligence solutions. The ideal candidate will transform raw data into meaningful insights that drive strategic decisions across the organization.

You will work closely with data engineers, business analysts, and stakeholders to create interactive dashboards, optimize data queries, and ensure high performance of BI systems.

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy interactive Tableau dashboards and reports for business stakeholders.

Write and optimize complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and data transformations to support analytics.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and translate them into effective visual solutions.

Build and maintain data models, calculated fields, and KPIs for consistent business reporting.

Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and performance in Tableau and underlying databases.

Integrate Tableau with various data sources (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle, Snowflake, AWS Redshift, Excel, etc.).

Implement row-level security and user access management for Tableau dashboards.

Automate report delivery and scheduling using Tableau Server or Tableau Cloud.

Participate in performance tuning, dashboard optimization, and query troubleshooting.

Document BI solutions, including data sources, calculations, and data flow logic.

Required Skills & Qualifications

4–7 years of experience developing dashboards and reports in Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server/Cloud.

Strong proficiency in SQL (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, or Snowflake) — including joins, CTEs, subqueries, and performance tuning.

Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL workflows.

Experience working with large datasets and optimizing for query performance.

Familiarity with data modeling techniques (star schema, snowflake schema).

Strong analytical mindset and ability to translate data into actionable insights.

Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in an Agile or fast-paced environment.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience integrating Tableau with Python, R, or REST APIs for advanced analytics.

Knowledge of Cloud data platforms such as Azure Synapse, AWS Redshift, or Google BigQuery.

Exposure to Data visualization best practices and storytelling techniques.

Familiarity with version control (Git) and DevOps deployment pipelines.

Tableau certification (e.g., Tableau Desktop Specialist / Certified Associate) is a plus.

Why Join Us

Work with cutting-edge BI tools and enterprise data platforms.

Collaborate with global data teams and business leaders to influence data-driven decisions.

Opportunity to shape the organization’s analytics strategy and deliver impactful insights.

Continuous learning and professional development in a data-first environment.

title: Data Analyst - Ecommerce
description:
We are seeking a hands-on eCommerce Analytics and Insights Lead to help establish and grow our newly launched eCommerce business. This role requires a data-savvy individual with deep eCommerce knowledge who can help define, build, and monitor performance KPIs, provide actionable insights, and guide the business on data-driven decision making. We are looking for someone who can get into the data, generate insights, help build dashboards, and work closely with cross-functional teams (buying, marketing, ops, tech) to guide the growth of our online channel.

Responsibilities
• Define and set up eCommerce KPIs across the customer journey (traffic, conversion, retention, basket size, etc. ).
• Work with marketing, merchandising, operations, and tech teams to establish data tracking and reporting needs.
• Help build dashboards and reports to monitor site performance, category performance, and marketing ROI.
• Identify trends, opportunities, and root causes of underperformance in areas such as: Product availability, Pricing and promotions, Checkout funnel performance, Customer retention, Channel acquisition effectiveness.
• Help set up cohort analysis, customer segmentation, and basic funnel analytics.
• Partner with the eCommerce and data engineering teams to ensure data quality and availability from digital channels.
• Propose data-driven experiments and quick-win ideas to accelerate growth.
• Guide and support business teams in understanding and interpreting digital KPIs.

Requirements
• 3-5 years of experience in eCommerce analytics, preferably in a grocery retail setup.
• Strong knowledge of eCommerce KPIs and analytics frameworks (traffic conversion, repeat LTV).
• Proficient with working knowledge of tools such as Google Analytics / GA4 Excel, SQL, Power BI, or Tableau.
• Experience working with digital marketing data, CRM data, and product performance data.
• Ability to translate business questions into data analysis and present clear insights.
• Familiarity with customer journey mapping, funnel conversion, basket analysis, etc.
• Comfortable working in fast-paced, ambiguous, and build-from-scratch environments.
• Strong communication and stakeholder management skills - able to work across functions.
• Strong in one of the programming languages - SQL/ Pyspark.

Good To Have
• Experience with eCommerce platforms (e. g., Shopify, Magento, Salesforce Commerce).
• Exposure to A/B testing, product recommendation analytics, or personalization logic.
• Knowledge of Python/R for deeper analysis (optional).
• Experience in setting up tracking infrastructure (e. g., GTM, event tagging).

This job was posted by Shone Joseph from Loyalytics AI.

title: Analyst/ Sr. Analyst - BI
description:
Introduction

We believe that every candidate brings something special to the table, including you! So, even if you feel that you're close but not an exact match, we encourage you to apply. We'd be thrilled to receive applications from exceptional individuals like yourself.

Gallagher, a global industry leader in insurance, risk management, and consulting services, boasts a team of over 50,000 professionals worldwide. Our culture, known as 'The Gallagher Way,' is driven by shared values and a passion for excellence. At the heart of our global operations, the Gallagher Center of Excellence (GCoE) in India, founded in 2006, upholds the values of quality, innovation, and teamwork. With 10,000+ professionals across five India locations, GCoE is where knowledge-driven individuals make a significant impact and build rewarding, long-term careers.

Overview

Should be able to work as an individual contributor and maintain good relationship with stakeholders. Should be proactive to learn new skills per business requirement. Familiar with extraction of relevant data, cleanse and transform data into insights that drive business value, through use of data analytics, data visualization and data modeling techniques.

How You'll Make An Impact
• Strong MS PowerBI skills.
• Hands-on experience in MS Azure SQL Database.
• Excellent knowledge of ETL packages using Visual Studio or Informatica
• Data analysis, Business analysis
• Database management and reporting (SQL & MS Azure SQL)
• Critical-thinking and problem-solving
• Excellent verbal and written Communication skills
• Review and validate customer data as it's collected

• Cooperate with IT department to deploy software and hardware upgrades that make it possible to leverage big data use cases
• Monitor analytics and metrics results
• Implement new data analysis methodologies
• Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies
• Good to have: Python/R

About You
• 2 to 5 years of experience in PowerBI
• Technical Bachelor's Degree
• Non-Technical Degree holders should have 3+ years of relevant experience.

Additional Information

We value inclusion and diversity

Inclusion and diversity (I&D) is a core part of our business, and it's embedded into the fabric of our organization. For more than 95 years, Gallagher has led with a commitment to sustainability and to support the communities where we live and work.

Gallagher embraces our employees' diverse identities, experiences and talents, allowing us to better serve our clients and communities. We see inclusion as a conscious commitment and diversity as a vital strength. By embracing diversity in all its forms, we live out The Gallagher Way to its fullest.

Gallagher believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity and prohibits any form of discrimination by its managers, employees, vendors or customers based on race, color, religion, creed, gender (including pregnancy status), sexual orientation, gender identity (which includes transgender and other gender non-conforming individuals), gender expression, hair expression, marital status, parental status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected (herein referred to as 'protected characteristics') by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Equal employment opportunity will be extended in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, layoff, and termination. In addition, Gallagher will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified person with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.

title: BI Analyst - Temp Staff
description:

You will be part of a team working on building next-generation data analytics dashboards to facilitate effective decision-making for Talent advisors and Talent Advisory Management. - Analytical and statistical skills.
- Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools such as Oracle BI, Oracle Analytics Cloud, Microsoft Power BI, etc.
- Familiarity with programming languages like SQL, Python, etc.
- Data modeling expertise.
- Strong Business Acumen and communication skills.
- Demonstrated Data Intuition.
- Experience with client and customer engagement.
- Knowledge of Machine Learning and AI (preferred).

Additional Company Details:
Oracle, a world leader in cloud solutions, utilizes cutting-edge technology to address current challenges across various industries. With a legacy of over 40 years, Oracle operates with integrity and collaborates with industry leaders to drive innovation. The company values an inclusive workforce that fosters opportunities for all employees and prioritizes work-life balance. Oracle offers competitive benefits, including flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options, while also encouraging community engagement through volunteer programs. The company is dedicated to inclusivity and supports individuals with disabilities throughout the employment process, offering accessibility assistance upon request.,

title: Business Intelligence Reporting Specialist
description:
POSITION SUMMARY: Designs and develops complex multi-system applications and drives collaboration with others to ensure effective project completion. Works collaboratively to develop and implement unit and system testing processes

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
• Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient ETL processes using tools such as Informatica ensuring optimal data extraction, transformation, and loading.
• Develop, and test reports using QlikSense reporting tools
• Develop and perform unit testing
• Migrate ETL artifacts between environments
• Work with Product Owner and BI team to understand business objectives in order to satisfy report and data warehouse design requirements and translate the data requirements into technical specifications.
• Optimize and troubleshoot ETL workflows to ensure data accuracy, performance, and reliability in batch and real-time processing environments.
• Develop and enforce data quality, data profiling, and validation checks throughout ETL pipelines.
• Create and maintain technical documentation for ETL processes, data flow diagrams, and architecture.
• Participate in code reviews, promote best practices, and contribute to improving the team's development standards.
• Ensure compliance with data governance, security policies, and privacy regulations (e.G., GDPR, HIPAA).
• Own and lead complex ETL troubleshooting efforts in production environments involving large datasets, multi-source systems, and time-sensitive business processes.
• Perform rapid root cause analysis on data integrity issues, performance bottlenecks, job failures, and unexpected data flow anomalies.
• Work cross-functionally with DBAs, infrastructure teams, DevOps, and data consumers to isolate and resolve production incidents with minimal downtime.
• Lead post-mortems for critical incidents and design permanent corrective actions to eliminate recurring problems
• Maintain strong SLAs and ensure compliance with data governance, audit, and security standards.
• Continuously explore and implement modern data engineering tools and practices.
• Interact with BI team to understand the source data
• Architect and design data warehouse structures for global usage and 24/7 availability
• Strong knowledge in SQL and PL/SQL.
• Incorporate appropriate data security throughout all development efforts
• Consistently look at the opportunity in all change
• Give and receive feedback in a constructive manner
• Resolve conflicts with little assistance
• Exemplifies Garmin’s Mission Statement and Quality Policy and proactively works to improve Garmin’s image and culture

EDUCATION EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:
• Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Management Information Systems, Business or another relevant field AND a minimum of 5 years relevant experience
• Outstanding academics
• Demonstrated experience in successful implementation of technology solutions
• Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively to drive projects to an effective and timely completion
• Experience with ETL tools such as Informatica and Talend
• Experience with QlikSense reporting suite
• Demonstrated strong and effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills in a large team or departmental setting

title: Oliver Wyman - Analyst (Power BI) - Hyderabad or Gurugram
description:
Oliver Wyman's Data & Analytics team is looking to hire for a Power BI specialist for our Hyderabad or Gurugram office.

OW DNA Overview

The Oliver Wyman DNA is a distinguished center of excellence for business analytics and data analytics within Oliver Wyman. This group leverages data and information to provide business insights to Oliver Wyman consulting teams driving positive outcomes and tangible impact for Oliver Wyman’s clients. The group combines cutting edge data science expertise with core consulting expertise to augment engagement teams with analytical firepower to deliver outstanding results.

Role Summary:

The Power BI Analyst will support business teams by developing high-quality dashboards, reports, and data models. This role is ideal for someone with strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to translate business requirements into simple and impactful visualizations. The Analyst will work closely with Senior Analysts and Lead Analysts to deliver data-driven insights

Key Responsibilities
• Develop Power BI dashboards, reports, and visualizations based on business requirements.
• Work with senior team members to understand KPIs, metrics, and data definitions.
• Perform data cleaning, transformation, and modeling using SQL, Power Query and DAX.
• Ensure accuracy and consistency of data across reports and data sources.
• Prepare documentation for dashboards, data models, and business logic.
• Conduct basic troubleshooting and performance optimization for reports.
• Support ad-hoc analysis requests from business stakeholders.
• Stay updated with Power BI features and best practices to improve reporting standards.

Education:
• Bachelor’s degree in science, Finance, Mathematics, Economics or equivalent. MS or Certificate courses in analytics preferred

Experience & Skills Requirements:
• Overall experience of 1+ years in Power BI, a business intelligence tool
• Strong foundational skills in Power Query, DAX, and data modelling
• Experience with Power BI ecosystem tools, including custom visuals, Dataflows, and Power Automate
• Ability to understand business logic and convert it into meaningful dashboards.
• Good knowledge of Excel, SQL, or other analytical tools.
• Strong attention to detail and data accuracy.
• Good communication skills and willingness to learn quickly.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple tasks.
• Experience using power automate, power apps and Sharepoint is preferred
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with proven ability to deliver actionable insights and proficiency in data modelling and visualization skills.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated ability to interact effectively with all levels of stakeholders (both internal and external)
• Fast learner with ability to learn and pick up a new tool/ platform quickly
• Advanced skills in MS-office, along with familiarity with Gen AI and other analytical tools preferred
• Willingness to travel as required to meet client needs.

Oliver Wyman, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a management consulting firm combining deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise to help clients optimize their business, improve operations and accelerate performance. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit oliverwyman.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.

Marsh McLennan is committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, caste, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, gender reassignment, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

title: Lead BI Analyst (Tableau Developer)
description:
As a Senior/Lead BI Analyst, you'll utilize your proficiency in Tableau, SQL, and Snowflake to build robust analytics solutions. In this role, you will support business strategy through impactful BI projects and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and insights that drive decision-making.

Responsibilities:
• Data Analysis & Reporting: Use SQL and Snowflake to extract, transform, and analyze data, delivering actionable insights to meet business needs.
• Tableau Dashboard Development: Build dynamic, visually engaging dashboards in Tableau, providing high-value insights for business users. Certification in Tableau is highly valued.
• Snowflake Architecture Integration: Work with Snowflake to streamline data processes and enable efficient data flow across the organization.
• Testing & Validation: Conduct data testing to ensure the accuracy and integrity of BI outputs across different scenarios.
• Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including data engineers and analysts, to understand requirements and ensure effective data utilization.

Requirements:
• 5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence with expertise in SQL, Tableau, and Snowflake.
• Strong proficiency in SQL for complex data manipulation, extraction, and transformation.
• Practical experience with Tableau for creating interactive dashboards; certification is highly preferred.
• Familiarity with data testing to ensure reliability and accuracy in reports.
• Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions, with excellent attention to detail.

Education:
• Bachelor/master's degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, quantitative studies, such as Statistics, Math, Operation Research, Economics, and Advanced.

title: Associate Analyst Business Intelligence & Reporting
description:
PepsiCo India is seeking a highly motivated and skilled Associate Analyst for its Data Science & Analytics department. This full-time, permanent position involves providing data and analytics support, including data acquisition, validation, and interpretation of results. The role requires a strong analytical mind to generate meaningful insights and recommendations for the Sales Leadership team within the beverage industry.

Key Responsibilities

Support the Commercial function with performance reporting against established KPIs, utilizing internal, shipment, POS data, and market data systems (IRI).
Develop on-demand reports and scorecards to improve agility and enhance data visualization.
Collate and format large and complex datasets across multiple channels, customers, and sales areas.
Analyze data to extract meaningful insights on performance trends and opportunities.
Present insights and recommendations to the Sales Leadership team in a clear and concise manner.
Ensure the delivery of accurate and timely data in accordance with agreed service level agreements (SLAs).

Qualifications / Requirements

Bachelor's degree in commerce, business administration, marketing, or finance is required. A Master's degree is a plus.
Minimum 5 years of experience in data analysis and reporting, with a strong understanding of data analysis and reporting tools.
Proven experience within the Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) industry is required.
Strong hands-on experience with Power BI, including DAX calculations and relationship building.
Proficiency in MS Office programs, specifically Excel, PowerPoint, and Access.
Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.

Preferred Skills / Attributes

Experience with Python or R for data modeling.
Strong relationship-building and customer service skills.
Knowledge of market data systems and data analysis techniques.
Excellent time management skills and the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively.
Experience with PepsiCo software systems.

title: BI Visualization & Reporting Analyst I (Tableau & SQL)
description:
BMS Hyderabad is an integrated global hub where our work is focused on helping patients prevail over serious diseases by building sustainable and innovative solutions. This important science, technology, and innovation center will support a range of technology and drug development activities that will help us usher in the next wave of innovation.

BI Visualization & Reporting Analyst I

Summary:

The Business Intelligence (BI) Visualization & Reporting Analyst position is a specialized role that focuses on developing and delivering insightful and visually impactful dashboards, reports, and data visualizations. The BI Visualization & Reporting Analyst collaborates with cross-functional teams, gathers requirements, designs and develops visualizations, performs data analysis, and ensures accurate and timely reporting to support data-driven decision-making and drive business growth for BMS globally.

Roles & Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with stakeholders to gather business requirements, understand key metrics and identify reporting and visualization needs
• Partner with senior analysts to design interactive and user-friendly dashboards, reports and visualizations using BI tools
• Create visually appealing and informative visualizations that communicate complex data sets and insights to non-technical stakeholders
• Perform data analysis to uncover patterns and insights that support strategic decision-making and business performance optimization
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and integrate data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and integrity
• Partner with senior analysts to develop and maintain data visualization best practices, standards and guidelines to ensure consistency and usability across different reporting and dashboard projects
• Optimize data infrastructure and enhance data quality to support efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes
• Stay updated with emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in data visualization, BI tools and reporting methodologies
• Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis and visualization to drive business growth, operational efficiency and improve data-driven decision-making processes

Skills & Competencies:
• Working knowledge of data visualization best practices, principles of effective design and user experience (UX) considerations.
• Experience with data analysis, interpretation and visualization to derive actionable insights from complex datasets
• Familiarity with data extraction, transformation and loading processes, data governance and data quality management
• Solid communication skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into meaningful and actionable recommendations for stakeholders
• Solid analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team
• Familiarity with the biopharma industry a plus , including knowledge of relevant data sources and KPIs
• Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines

Experience:
• We welcome a bachelor's or master's degree in a relevant field such as Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
• Proven experience (typically 1 to 3 years) in a BI visualization through work or school projects
• Have a strong commitment to a career in technology with a passion for healthcare
• Proficiency in business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms
• Experience with data analysis, visualization and report development
• knowledge of data modeling, SQL, and data manipulation techniques.
• Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Spacelabs - Hyderabad, Telangana
description:
Job Requirements

We are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, data mining, and reporting. The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for developing and maintaining data models, creating and executing queries, and creating reports. The analyst will also be responsible for developing and maintaining dashboards and visualizations.

The successful candidate will have excellent problem-solving skills, be able to think critically, and have the ability to work independently. The candidate should also have strong communication skills and be able to work effectively with stakeholders.

Responsibilities:

• Develop and maintain data models, queries, and reports

• Develop and maintain dashboards and visualizations

• Analyze data to identify trends and patterns

• Develop and maintain data quality standards

• Develop and maintain data security standards

• Work with stakeholders to identify and prioritize business intelligence needs

• Provide technical support to stakeholders

• Develop and maintain documentation

Requirements:

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration or related field

• 3+ years of experience in data analysis, data mining, and reporting

• Proficiency in SQL and database management

• Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau

• Knowledge of data security and data quality standards

• Excellent problem-solving skills

• Strong communication skills

• Ability to work independently

FAQs:

Q: What qualifications are required for this position?

A: The ideal candidate should have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration or related field and 3+ years of experience in data analysis, data mining, and reporting.

Q: What are the responsibilities of the Business Intelligence Analyst?

A: The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for developing and maintaining data models, creating and executing queries, and creating reports. The analyst will also be responsible for developing and maintaining dashboards and visualizations. The analyst will also be responsible for developing and maintaining data quality standards and data security standards.

Q: What skills are required for this position?

A: The successful candidate should have excellent problem-solving skills, be able to think critically, and have the ability to work independently. The candidate should also have strong communication skills and be able to work effectively with stakeholders. Proficiency in SQL and database management and experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau are also required.

title: BI Analysts Sigma
description:
As a BI Analyst at Sigma, your role involves analyzing current dashboards and data products to identify areas for improvement and enhancement. You will be responsible for conducting data exploration, profiling, and documentation activities to ensure data accuracy and consistency. Your key responsibilities include:

- Analyzing current dashboards and data products to perform detailed landscape analysis from technical and business process perspectives
- Preparing detailed usage statistics, data lineage, and mapping of existing to new dashboards
- Performing gap analysis between old and new data products, identifying impacted visualizations, and proposing solutions for retrofitting or building new dashboards
- Validating and testing dashboards for data accuracy, consistency, and user requirements, including User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
- Collaborating with business stakeholders to interpret findings and translate them into actionable recommendations
- Documenting metadata, data definitions, lineage, and transformation logic
- Developing comprehensive documentation and user guides for dashboards and business logic
- Supporting adhoc analysis and scenario modeling for strategic decision support

Tools and Technologies:
- Power BI
- Tableau
- Sigma
- Excel
- Alteryx
- PowerPoint

In addition to the responsibilities mentioned above, BI Analysts at Sigma are expected to work with a variety of dashboarding and data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Sigma, Excel, Alteryx, and prepare documentation and presentations using PowerPoint.,

title: Business Analyst with Power BI experience
Sr.Business Intelligence Engineer, -
description:
Description

As a Sr.Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE), you will be responsible for building and maintaining a highly scalable, reliable and efficient reporting and analytical system to support the fast-growing business. You will be collaborating with various business teams in identifying reporting/analytical requirement, building required data model, acquiring new data sources and building comprehensive data visualizations for key stakeholders. You will mine data, identify data co-relation across different functional areas, run statistical analysis, gather insights and make recommendations based on your findings to help senior leaders make key business decisions. Data analysis is at the core Amazon’s of culture and your work will have a direct impact on decision making and strategy for organizations. You will work with analytical tools, can write excellent SQL scripts, optimize performance of SQL queries and can partner with internal customers to answer key business questions. We look for candidates who are self-motivated, flexible, hardworking and who like to have fun.

Key job responsibilities
• Develop complex queries for ad hoc requests and projects, as well as ongoing reporting.
• Design, develop and maintain scalable, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc. that will support our analytical and business needs
• Design, implement, and support key datasets that provide structured and timely access to actionable business information addressing stakeholder needs.
• Interface directly with stakeholders, gathering requirements and owning automated end-to-end reporting solutions.
• Partner with analysts, data engineers, business intelligence engineers, and software development engineers across Amazon to produce complete data solutions.
• Simplify and automate reporting, audits, and other data-driven activities; build solutions to have maximum scale and self-service ability by stakeholders
• Proficiency with SQL queries to retrieve and analyze data. Learn and understand a broad range of Amazon’s data resources and know how, when, and which to use.
• Surface and track key product metrics that reveal opportunities for innovation and optimization
• Mentor teammates, provide inputs in team and org level strategic planning, lead cross org discussions

Basic Qualifications
• 10+ years of SQL experience
• Experience programming to extract, transform and clean large (multi-TB) data sets
• Experience with theory and practice of design of experiments and statistical analysis of results
• Experience with AWS technologies
• Experience in scripting for automation (e.g. Python) and advanced SQL skills.
• Experience with theory and practice of information retrieval, data science, machine learning and data mining

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience working directly with business stakeholders to translate between data and business needs
• Experience managing, analyzing and communicating results to senior leadership
• Master's degree in statistics, data science, or an equivalent quantitative field

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. title: Power BI & CRM Analyst - SQL
description:

About the Role :

We are seeking talented professionals with strong expertise in Power BI development and CRM analytics to join our team in Hyderabad. You will be responsible for building advanced analytical solutions, creating impactful dashboards, and translating complex data into actionable business insights.

- Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards, KPI scorecards, and visual reports in line with business requirements.

- Ability to design data models and perform requirement analysis effectively.

Why Join Us?

- Opportunity to work on end-to-end BI projects with industry-leading tools and technologies.

- Collaborative and growth-focused environment.

- Exposure to large-scale CRM and marketing analytics use cases.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Description

Our healthcare customer is looking for someone who has a BI data science! Over the past 3 years our client has built a robust Power BI engine for data consolidation, visualization, and reporting, and is now exploring Ai functions. The position is less about typical Power BI visualizations and more about integrating AI with BI data, focusing on data science, search, match algorithms, and statistical analysis. Detail orientation is crucial for ensuring data quality and integrity during transformations between systems (e.g., warehouse to graph database) to prevent "garbage" data.

Our customer aims to use machine to analyze historical data, identify patterns, and generate actionable, micro-level insights (e.g., churn rates, premium positions) for reports. Like a lot of companies they are bridging the gap between data, Ai and reporting.

Job Description:

This person will help drive strategic insights through advanced modeling, cloud-native-data architecture and scalable reporting solutions. They aren’t a lead or a manager, but they are key in helping in these areas. The Business Intelligence Analyst collaborates with cross-functional teams to operationalize data products that support enterprise-wide decision-making.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

· Implementation of end-to-end data solutions, including ingestion, transformation, modeling, and visualization across Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse, and Power BI.

· Maintain Lakehouse environments using OneLake, Dataflows Gen2, and Notebooks to support scalable analytics and machine learning workflows.

· Develop and deploy predictive models, classification systems, and recommendation engines 

· Build and optimize ETL pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Spark, and Delta Lake within Fabric environments.

· Design and implement semantic models and tabular datasets in Power BI and Fabric for enterprise reporting and self-service analytics.

· Be involved with efforts in data governance and data quality assurance

· Perform statistical analysis, feature engineering, and model validation to support business forecasting and scenario planning.

· Collaborate with data engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define data architecture, analytics strategy, and KPI frameworks.

· Automate complex reporting workflows using Python, SQL, Power Query, and Fabric Pipelines.

· Mentor junior analysts and contribute to the development of best practices in BI, data science, and cloud analytics.

· Monitor performance of BI systems and proactively identify opportunities for optimization and innovation.

· Provide thought leadership in the adoption of AI/ML, real-time analytics, and data-as-a-product principles.

Minimum Requirements:

· Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field.

title: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Description The Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst provides expertise utilizing a wide range of business intelligence principles, theories, concepts, or techniques to solve problems or make recommendations relating to customer requirements, specifications, and quality assurance standards. The best candidate is able to work independently to develop and review complex requirements. The Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst develops and evaluates new or existing complex systems or processes. The Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst consults with and advises customers concerning efficient methods of automating, implementing, or improving business processes in relation to existing or future systems.

The Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for the support of database development and maintenance within the Resource Management and Transformation (RMT) Division of the Office of the Chief Financial Officer, having in depth customer knowledge, providing Oracle support, developing APEX and Tableau solutions on behalf of Department of Homeland Security (DHS) clients, as well as managing the expectations and relationships of business stakeholders.

You will be part of a team who will:
• Develop database applications in an Oracle APEX environment
• Design, create, deploy, and manage the organizational data structure, translating business needs into mission appropriate long-term data architecture solutions including data access analysis and warehousing design and implementation.
• Review and develop data reference architecture, data models, and the metadata repository to structure the data for better management focusing on secure and rapid access.
• Develop strategies for data acquisitions, archive and recovery, and implementation planning. Develop data warehousing blueprints, evaluating hardware and software platforms, and systems integration.
• Assist with cloud architecture and migration
• Create/edit reports in Excel and other tools
• Support report generation using OCFO Operational Tracker and RMT Flight Deck (Apex applications) and Tableau

You will also:
• Participate in the data governance, review, and refinement of data and metadata standards in alignment with customer data and data technology standards that include attribute based access control.
• Collaborate with team members to develop data plans and proposed solutions that will interface and enhance current Government architectures.
• Participate in data design reviews and data integration in support of project transition into production.
• Contribute to operational plans including data technology, data storage management, and architectural criteria that promote continual data assessment and audit capabilities for security and quality control. Create documentation and contribute to architectural and migration efforts for data in a Cloud environment.
• Support engineering and development efforts working in a DHS Systems Engineering LifeCycle (SELC) environment.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills Education & Experience Requirements:
• It is required that each candidate has a bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in business, information technology, science, finance, or another related discipline
• At least 10 years of relevant experience.
• In-depth understanding of database structure principles
• Experience in an Oracle APEX environment
• Experience gathering and analyzing system requirements
• Expertise in SQL, NoSQL, or Jira query language solutions
• Familiarity with data visualization and modeling tools
• Knowledge of data mining and segmentation techniques
• Must be able to obtain DHS EOD.

Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills
• Able to work independently to develop and review complex requirements
• Proven work experience as a Data Architect or similar role in the Federal Government
• In-depth understanding of database documentation, data integration and data migration (on-premise to Cloud)
• Expertise in Cloud data tools
• Expertise in verbal and written skills to lead discussions and documentation efforts
• Familiarity with Informatica/ETL processes

Pay Information
Full-Time Salary Range: $130355 - $221603

Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.

Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.
About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.

Intelligence & Security (I&S), based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels.

This position will be posted for at least 5 calendar days. The posting will remain active until the position is filled, or a qualified pool of candidates is identified.

title: BI Analyst / Business Analyst
description:
BI Analyst / Business Analyst

Location: Washington, DC. This is a mostly remote position with occasional trips to DOT HQ at the customer’s discretion.

Clearance Requirements: Public Trust or US Citizen eligible to obtain a Public Trust

Job Summary:

InDev is seeking a proactive BI Analyst / Business Analyst to support PHMSA’s data warehouse modernization and reporting transformation initiatives. This role extends beyond a traditional Business Analyst position, incorporating a strong business-intelligence focus. In addition to core BA responsibilities, you will support data-driven initiatives, collaborate closely with AI engineers, and contribute to the analysis and interpretation of data that guides strategic decisions. You will gather and document business requirements, support report rationalization efforts, and translate stakeholder needs into actionable technical specifications. As a Business Analyst, you’ll work closely with federal stakeholders, project managers, and technical teams to ensure that reporting solutions and data products meet mission-critical operational needs. Your contributions will help guide the migration from legacy OBIEE reporting to a modern Tableau environment, improving data-driven decision-making across PHMSA.

This is a direct-hire, full-time position with salary and benefits. InDev provides a comprehensive benefits package, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k with match, Flexible Spending Account, and Paid Time Off (PTO)—including vacation and holiday pay.

Key Responsibilities:
• Gather, document, and analyze business and technical requirements for data migration, reporting, and visualization initiatives.
• Facilitate workshops and interviews with PHMSA stakeholders to understand reporting needs and priorities.
• Lead stakeholder interviews and requirements gathering to identify critical vs. redundant reports.
• Translate stakeholder needs into clear functional specifications for developers and data engineers.
• Establishes data stewardship roles and procedures with PHMSA stakeholders.
• Collaborate with technical teams to validate that Tableau dashboards and reports align with documented business objectives.
• Participate in UAT and change management activities to support stakeholder adoption of new tools and technologies.
• Support data governance planning by documenting data usage, definitions, and reporting standards.
• Track and report on project progress, risks, and dependencies related to reporting and data solutions.
• Ensure that deliverables meet federal compliance standards and PHMSA operational requirements.
• Serve as a communication bridge between technical teams and non-technical stakeholders.
• Translate business needs into clear, actionable functional specifications through close collaboration with AI engineers.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business, or a related scientific, technical, or functional discipline.
• Familiarity with relational databases and data concepts, including exposure to Oracle.
• Familiarity with Tableau and basic understanding of data visualization concepts.
• Minimum of 2 years of professional experience.
• Experience gathering and documenting functional and technical requirements.
• Strong understanding of reporting environments and BI tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
• Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and reporting workflows.
• Proficiency with using Jira and Confluence for project tracking, documentation, and collaboration.
• Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
• Ability to work with both technical and non-technical federal stakeholders.
• Experience supporting federal government IT projects in an Agile environment.
• Knowledge of data governance principles and compliance requirements is a plus.
• Experience supporting report rationalization and data migration initiatives is desirable.

About Us: At InDev, we're not just a company; we're a trailblazing force transforming the way data analysis shapes the future. As a dynamic player in the federal government sector, we're on a mission to empower agencies with cutting-edge IT solutions that drive innovation, efficiency, and progress. Our team thrives on collaboration, innovation, and embracing challenges head-on to create a meaningful impact on the world around us. Let’s innovate. www.indev.com

Why InDev:
• Innovative Environment: Join a team that thrives on creativity and innovation, where your ideas are not only heard but encouraged.
• Meaningful Impact: Contribute to projects that directly impact federal agencies, driving positive change on a national scale.
• Dynamic Collaboration: Work alongside diverse experts who are passionate about pushing boundaries and making a difference.
• Agile Mindset: Embrace Agile methodologies that encourage flexibility, adaptability, and rapid growth.
• Learning Culture: Enjoy ongoing learning opportunities and professional development to expand your skill set.
• Cutting-edge Tech: Engage with the latest technologies and tools in the data integration landscape.

If you're ready to embark on a journey of innovation, collaboration, and impact, InDev welcomes you to join our team as a BI Analyst / Business Analyst. Let's shape the future together.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Up to $83,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• 401(k) matching
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Life insurance
• Paid time off
• Vision insurance

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Washington, DC 20003
